loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, soap and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Hofiadé A. Rosine

texts.fr: T. Hofiadé A. Rosine est née le 21 Mars 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosine vit depuis 30 ans à Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Mariée à ZOUMENOU Gilbert, Rosine est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Rosine supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Rosine vend depuis près de 12 ans des mèches et des produits pour cheveux. C'est une coiffeuse qui a son atelier à Ayélawadjè. Rosine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rosine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est dans l'optique d'augmenter ses produits et de satisfaire plus la demande de la clientèle que Rosine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
T. Hofiadé A. Rosine was born on March 21, 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For 30 years, she has been living in Ayélawadjè in Cotonou. Married to ZOUMENOU Gilbert, she is the mother of two children who are both in school. Rosine along with her husband supports the family. Rosine has sold hair extensions and hair products for nearly 12 years. She is a hairdresser who has her own salon in Ayélawadjè. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who has already obtained three loans, which were repaid. With regard to augmenting her merchandise and satisfying customer demand further, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Cecelia Group

texts.en:
Naomi B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Cecelia Group. She is 39 years old, married with 6 children aged 11-22 years old. Her children’s educational levels range from 6th grade to university student. Naomi is a 10th grade drop-out, due to poverty. She decided to get into business. Naomi lives and works in the West Point community, close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Naomi’s business is her provision shop. She buys provisions such as milk, sugar, margarine, candles, and etc. from a wholesaler and sells retail to residents of West Point, close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 3 years, and hopes to improve the business in the future.

Naomi keeps her business clean and sells quality goods in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase more provisions like milk, sugar, candles and etc. to improve business. Naomi dreams of giving her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions like milk, sugar, candles and etc. to improve business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 24-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Khaled has been working as a DJ since 2003. He takes care of private parties like weddings, events and more. Khaled requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a car to transport his DJ materials. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan. Khaled is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors, agencies and whoever needs him for an event or celebration. When he first started his business, he had difficulty in purchasing all the required tools and sound systems for his work. He decided on doing his business because from a young age he had always wanted to be a DJ. In the future, he plans to improve his work by always having the best materials for his work.

loans.use: To purchase a car to transport his DJ materials .

loans.name: Eunice Awour

texts.en: Eunice is twenty-five years old, married and mother to two daughters. She runs a hardware business where she sells screws, nails, light bulbs and wires to walk-ins and frequent customers. She currently has one employee. Her business challenge is the fluctuating demand. She is using the loan proceeds of KES 40,000 to increase stock for the hardware store. In future, she wants to be a wholesaler and to further educate her children. Eunice describes herself as hardworking, friendly and honest.

loans.use: To buy hardware items such as, screws, lightbulbs, cables and nails.

loans.name: Forjemos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Nuestras socias, pertenecen al banco comunal “FORJEMOS EL FUTURO”, viven en el distrito D. “San Jerónimo” en la provincia del Cusco. El banco esta conformado por 10 socias y la mayoría D. ellas tienen un negocio independiente pero con actividades D. trabajo similares. La reunión D. las socias se hace en el casa D. la socia Sebastiana. 

Nuestros socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta D. comida. Un gran parte se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, comida y víveres. El socio Eliseo tiene un carro que hace el servicio D. transportes en la ciudad. Una D. las socias D. este banco se dedican a la venta D. productos D. belleza (perfumes, aretes, pulseras, carteras, etc.), otras socias tienen tiendas D. abarrotes donD. venden arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. La socia Sebastiana tiene un pequeño restaurante D. venta D. comida, ella prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena.     

Las socias solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital D. trabajo y D. esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(La socio  Casimira no aparece en la fotografía porque pidió permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal por motivos D. viajes)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank “Forjemos El Futuro” (We Shape our Future). They live in the San Jeronimo District, Cusco province. The bank is maD. up of 10 members. The majority have their own businesses but of similar types. They meet in the home of one of the members, Sebastiana. They alternate their household activities with the sale of food. Many of them sell cosmetics, food and supplies. The member Eliseo has a car that he uses for transport services in the city. One of the members sells beauty products (perfumes, earrings, bracelets, wallets, etc). Other members have grocery stores where they sell rice, sugar, oil, etc. Sebastiana has a small restaurant where she sells food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The members are asking for a loan as work capital that they will use to increase their merchandise and improve their sales. This will make the lives of their families better. The members appreciate the loan that they receive this way and promise to make their payments in the established timeframe. (The member Casimira asked the bank directors’ permission not to be photographed because of travel)

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get capital to increase their sales of food

loans.name: Aïssétou

texts.fr: M. Aïssétou est née en 1953 à Djougou au Nord du Bénin. Mariée à BAGRI Kora, un agent de la mairie de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Aïssétou est mère de sept enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Aïssétou vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Kowégbo à Cotonou, depuis douze ans. Aïssétou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Aïssétou vend des condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, etc.), de l’huile d’arachide, et également du maïs à son domicile. Aïssétou a déjà 10 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Aïssétou s’approvisionne. Aïssétou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits antérieurs et qui ont été bien remboursés. C’est pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle que Aïssétou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
M. Aïssétou was born in 1953 in Djougou in northern Benin.  Married to BAGRI Kora, a representative of the townhall of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, she is the mother of seven children who are all in school.  For 12 years, she has been living with her children and husband in the Houéyiho district in Cotonou.  She comes to her husband's aid in meeting family expenses.  To address her needs, Aïssétou sells sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, etc.), peanut oil, and also corn out of her home.  She already has ten years of experience in this domain.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stock up.  She is a previous ALIDé client, having already benefited from three past loans, which were repaid.  To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers further, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sauce condiments, drums of peanut oil, and sacks of corn

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Sela M. from Tukuyu. She is single and has 2 children between the ages of 5 and 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents cannot care for him. Sela has been running a Duka business since 2000. She owns a small duka, or neighborhood shop, in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Sela currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more shop items such as cartons of sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil in bulk.  In the future, she plans to increase the size of her business. Sela thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items such as cartons of sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, sugar and maize flour in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Sévérine

texts.fr: L. Sévérine est née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ALLAGBE Lawal, Sévérine est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Sévérine habite depuis près de 6 ans, le quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Sévérine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Il y a une douzaine d’année que Sévérine vend des liqueurs de tous genres à Gbogbanou à Cotonou. Sévérine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits et qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter son stock de liqueurs pour satisfaire sa clientèle à l’approche des fêtes, Sévérine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
L. Sévérine was born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to ALLAGBE Lawal, she is the mother of three children who are all in school. For nearly six years, she has lived in the Yénawa district in Cotonou with her husband and children. The couple provides for the family jointly. Sévérine attended school through the secondary level. For a dozen years, she has been selling liqueurs of all kinds in Gbogbanou in Cotonou. She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client, having already benefited from three loans, which have been repaid. To augment her stock of liqueurs, to satisfy her customers as the holidays approach, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy liqueurs

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Flora J. from Tukuyu. She is married and has 3 children, between the ages of 2 and 12. Flora has been running a clothes Business since 2003. Her business is to purchase clothes an a wholesale basis and to sell by retail. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Flora currently earns about 124USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve the quality of her business. Flora thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric in bulk for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials in bulk

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Enea M. from Tukuyu. She is married with one child.  Enea has been running a clothes business since 2005, purchasing and selling clothes.  She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by three family members. Enea currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business.  In the future, she plans to start a new business. Enea thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: K. Edith est née en 1954 à Tanzoun au Bénin. Edith est mariée à TOVIZOUNKOUN Joseph et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Edith réside depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est avec ses enfants et son conjoint que Edith vit. Seul Joseph supporte les charges de la famille. Edith n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est pourquoi, depuis une vingtaine d’année, Edith vend du maïs et également de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) à son domicile. Edith s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Edith n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de ALIDé. Pour mieux développer son activité et accroître plus sa clientèle, Edith sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Edith was born in 1954 in Tanzoun in Benin.  She is married to TOVIZOUNKOUN Joseph and is the mother of three children who are all in school.  For about 15 years, she has been residing in the Hlacomey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She lives with her children and husband, Joseph, who is solely responsible for supporting the family. Edith has never been to school.  This is why, for some 20 years, she has been selling corn and also akassa (a local food made with corn starch) out of her home.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has never had an ALIDé loan before.  To develop her business more and to grow her customer base further, she's requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a hard working man who lives with his family in Ogbomoso town in Oyo state, Nigeria. He is married with five children. He is 62 years old. He has been a LAPO client for two years. He sells foodstuffs like bunches of plantain and peppers. His greatest joy in his business is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. Amos hopes for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: K. Denise est née en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOVOEYAN Salako Michel,  Denise est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a trois ans de cela que Denise vit au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la maison. Denise vend des divers (pâtes alimentaires, biscuits, lait, pâte dentifrice, lait corporel, sardine, pommade pour cheveux, savons, bicarbonate, etc.) à son domicile. Denise s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Denise a déjà 10 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine, et a bénéficié déjà d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. En vue d’augmenter la taille de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, Denise sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Denise was born in 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to DOVOEYAN Salako Michel, she is the mother of two children who are both in school.  She has been living for three years in the Agbodjèdo district in Cotonou with her husband and children.  The couple provides for the family jointly. Denise sells a variety of goods (pasta, cookies, milk, toothpaste, body lotion, sardines, hair ointment, soaps, bicarbonate, etc.) out of her home.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She already has ten years of experience in this domain and has benefited from an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid.  With the aim of expanding her business and growing her customer base, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (boxes of pasta, canned foods, milk, ointments, soaps)

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 50 years old, married with six children.Her children are excelling in school. She sells foodstuffs and food spices at retail prices to her customers. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 55 años, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos que ya son mayores D. edad, trabajan y la apoyan en todo. DesD. hace 7 años se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, empezó como agente vendedora y ahora, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, es una ejecutiva D. ventas y la encargada D. comprar en cantidad estos productos para abastecer a sus agentes vendedoras.
Juana trabaja durante todo el día, ya que tiene que monitorear a 118 vendedoras y le gusta hacerlo con mucha paciencia, para poder dirigirlas eficientemente. 
Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que se relaciona con muchas personas y a raíz D. ello ha hecho muchos clientes y amistades, además es un negocio rentable y seguro.

Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta D. su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se entienden y trabajan muy bien. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos D. belleza para seguir incrementando su stock.
texts.en:
Juana is 55 years old, a widow, and lives with her two children. They are already adults who work and help her in every way. For the last 7 years, she has dedicated herself to selling beauty products. Juana began as a sales agent and now, thanks to her efforts and dedication, she is a sales executive, in charge of purchasing in quantity the products to supply her sales agents.

Juana works all day long, since she has to monitor 118 sales agents. She likes to do this patiently, in order to direct them efficiently.

What she likes best about her work is that in puts her in touch with many people. As a result, it has given her many clients and friendships. Besides, it is a profitable and secure business.

This is her 5th loan through MFP, and what she likes best about her community bank is that she and her companions get along and work together very well. With the money that Juana now solicits, she will buy more beauty products to continue augmenting her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE HER MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Ketilut

texts.es:
Ketilut tiene 33 años, es madre de dos hijos estudiantes y vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. 
Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles, bebidas y productos de belleza, todos estos productos los ofrece en un pequeño ambiente que acondicionó al frente de su casa.
Pero Ketilut también envía estos comestibles a los caseríos que están alejados de la ciudad.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente y dar un trato amable al momento de vender, pero sobre todo le agrada ver que día a día sigue progresando pues cuenta con cuenta con una gran clientela y buenos ingresos diarios. 

Con MFP ya tiene 12 préstamos y está muy contenta por que gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal está saliendo adelante, además que todos son personas muy responsables en su trabajo y con sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo usará en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ketilut is 33, the mother of two children who are in school. She lives with her husband who works transporting passengers. For the last 7 years she has been selling food, drinks and beauty products in a small area that she set up in front of her house. But Ketilut also sends food to small villages that are far from the city. What she likes most about her work is to meet people and treat them well when she is selling. But she especially likes to see that every day she is getting more customers and good profits. With MFP she has already had 12 loans and is very happy because of the support of the communal bank in helping her get ahead. Also the people are very responsible in their work and with their payments. The money that she is asking for now will be used to buy large quantities of products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Mayra De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Mayra de Jesús Rodríguez, es una señora dedicada a la venta de ropa, zapato, carteras y demás accesorios, ambulante en diferente departamento del país, desde hace cinco años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no tiene un transporte seguro para trasladar la mercadería, ya que en ocasiones a perdido su producto, con el primer financiamiento logro tener mas inventario y abastecer mas clientes , ella inicio esta actividad con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior , a la vez cuenta con el apoyo de sus cuatro hijos los cuales ayudan en el negocio en diferentes días ya que estos estudian para poder ayudar a su mamá en un futuro económicamente  y poder darle mejores condiciones de vida. Agradece ala institución por el financiamiento el cual comprara ropa, y zapatos para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra de Jesús Rodríguez is a dedicated woman who sells clothes, shoes, purses, and other accessories. She is a street vendor in a different department of the country. She has been doing this for five years. The greatest difficulty she has is not having safe transportation to transport her merchandise. She has occasionally lost her products. With her first loan she was able to get more inventory and provide for her customers. She started this activity upon liquidation of her previous work. She has the support of her four children, who help in the business on different days. They are in school to be able to help their mother economically in the future. They will also be able to provide better living conditions. She is grateful to the institution for the loan, which she will use to buy clothes and shoes to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: D. Françoise est née en 1957 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Françoise est mariée et est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Françoise vit seule au quartier Kowégbo depuis près de 15 ans, et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Françoise n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins, Françoise vend des boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) ainsi que divers produits (biscuits, bonbons, papiers mouchoirs, etc.) à Kowégbo. Françoise a 30 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Françoise fait ses achats. Françoise est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est dans l’optique de renforcer la vente des liqueurs et d’augmenter son fonds de roulement que Françoise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Françoise was born in 1957 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married and the mother of five children who are all in school.  For nearly 15 years, she has been living alone in the Kowégbo district and is the sole breadwinner of the family.  Françoise has never been to school.  To support herself, she sells alcoholic drinks (liqueurs), as well as a variety of goods (cookies, candy, tissues, etc.) in Kowégbo.  She has 30 years of experience in this domain.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she makes her purchases.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  With regard to bolsteiring her sales of liqueurs and increasing her working capital, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of liqueurs and various goods (cookies and candy) to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 44 años, vive junto a su esposo, quien es profesor, y con dos hijos que están estudiando.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas de varias líneas cosméticas, estos productos son muy demandados por las personas que viven en su zona, por ello que tiene muchos pedidos. Maria brinda crédito a sus clientes, y les cobra cada día durante la semana, tal como acuerda con cada uno de ellos. 
Por otro lado, también es muy buena en la decoración y preparación de tortas, las cuales elabora cada vez que se lo solicitan para una fiesta o evento social.
Para el futuro, le gustaría tener también una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender toda clase de prendas.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y considera que es muy bueno trabajar en equipo, además ya está acostumbrada a sus compañeros y existe mucho compañerismo y responsabilidad entre ellos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza y una vitrina más grande para  proteger sus productos, los cuales requieren de mucho cuidado.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, lives with her husband, who is a teacher, and her two children, who are studdying. She has been selling perfume, cosmetics, and jewelry from various cosmetic lines for five years. These products are in high demand by the people who live in her area, so she has a lot of orders. Maria offers her clients credit, and then charges them each day of the way according to an agreement between herself and each client. On the side, she is also very good at making and decorating cakes, which she bakes whenever there is an order for a party or a special event. This is her second loan from MFP. She is part of a communal bank, which considers her to be a good team worker. In addition, she is now accustomed to working with her peers, and there is a lot of mutual support and responsibility within the group. With the money she is soliciting, Maria will buy more beauty products and a larger glass counter to protect her products, which require a great deal of care.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 29 years old, married to Mr. A. and they both live in the Delta State. She learned hair dressing in order to empower herself and assist her siblings to make a better living in the future.  Beatrice now owns a hair dressing saloon and she want to add the sales sells of sarongs in ordern other to increase her profits. She is requesting for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase sarongs to sell.  She hopes for a big business in future.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth,42, is married and has four children. She styles and braids hair and sells hair extension and hair accessories to customers in her store.  To meet the demand, she hopes to employ more people and buy two hair dryers. Festive season is coming and she will be extra busy. She hopes for a loan of N100,000.

loans.use: Purchase more hair dryer.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: A. Marguerite est née le 18 Juillet 1982 à Dangbo, non loin de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Marguerite réside au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis près de 10 ans. Mariée à DASSI Fulbert, un menuisier, Marguerite est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Marguerite vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Seul Fulbert assure les charges de la famille. Marguerite n’a jamais été à l’école. Ainsi depuis douze ans, Marguerite vend des habits et des pommades corporelles de façon ambulante. Marguerite fait ses achats à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’augmenter la taille de son activité et de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, Marguerite sollicite un sixième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Marguerite was born on July 18, 1982 in Dangbo, not far from Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  For nearly 10 years, she has been residing in the Gankpodo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to DASSI Fulbert, a furniture maker, she is the mother of two children who are both in school.  Marguerite lives together with her husband and children.  Fulbert alone ensures that family expenses are met.  Marguerite has never been to school.  Thus, for a dozen years, she has been selling clothing and body ointments from door-to-door.  She acquires her merchandise in Lomé, Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  To expand her business and to satisfy her customers further, she's requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 59 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, siendo una de ellas todavía menor de edad y estudiante. 

Desde hace 8 años alquila tres habitaciones de su casa, negocio que le va muy bien porque sus inquilinos son estables. Pero como es una mujer con mucho empeño en el trabajo, los sábados y domingos también vende comida (parrilladas, anticuchos y comidas regionales), esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años atrás. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sentirse activa, además le es rentable porque sus ingresos son fijos. Posteriormente le gustaría tener un minimarket.

Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos son amables y cumplidos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a refaccionar sus habitaciones para brindarles a sus inquilinos un ambiente más acogedor.
texts.en:
Marlene is 59 years old, currently lives with her husband and two daughters, one of whom is still young and studying. For 8 years, Marlene has been renting out three rooms in her house, a business which has been going well because her tenants have been stable. Nevertheless, because she is a very entrepreneurial woman, she has also been selling food (barbecued foods, kebabs, and other regional specialties) on Saturdays and Sundays for the past 3 years. What she likes best about her work is the feeling of being active, as well as the ability to be profitable because revenues are constant. Before, she would have liked to have had a minimarket. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is happy to be part of a communal bank because all her peers are nice and accomplished. With the funds from this loan, she will refurbish her rented rooms to offer her tenants more comfortable conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishing rented rooms

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Nuestras socias, pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”. El nombre es original del idioma Quechua que traducido al español significa "Caminemos juntos". Ellos viven en el distrito de “San Santiago” en la provincia del Cusco. El banco esta conformado por 11 socias y la mayoría de ellas tienen un negocio independiente pero con actividades de trabajo similares. La reunión de las socias se hace en la casa de la socia Lourdes. 

Nuestros socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. Un gran parte se dedica a la venta de pasto (comida para animales de corral), comida y víveres. El socio Jaime tiene un carro que hace el servicio de transportes en la ciudad. Una de las socias de este banco se dedican a la venta de pasto (comida para animales de corral), otras socias tienen tiendas de abarrotes donde venden arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Una de las socias tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida, ella prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena.     

Las socias solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Las socias valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our clients belong to the communal bank “SUMAC PURIRISUN.” The name is originally from Quechua, and means “Let's walk together.” They live in the “San Santiago” district in Cusco province. The bank is made up of 11 members and the majority of them have their own independent, but similar, businesses. The group meetings are held in the home of the borrower Lourdes. These members balance their various household activities with the sale of food. A large portion of them sell grass (food for farmyard animals), food, and supplies. The member Jaime has a car that he uses to provide transportation services in the city. One of the members of this bank sells grass (food for farmyard animals), others own general stores where they sell rice, sugar, oil, etc. One of the members of the bank has a small booth where she sells food, offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The members are soliciting this loan for working capital so that they can offer more products and increase their sales, in order to better the quality of life of their families. All the members appreciate and are thankful for the loan they are receiving through this system, and thus have themselves promised to make all their payments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing capital to develop the sale of supplies.

loans.name: Rider

texts.es:
Rider tiene 37 años, es padre de 4 hijos, vive con su pareja desde hace 16 años en la casa una de sus tías.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su propio motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas con quien comparte muy amenas conversaciones, además es muy importante para él brindar un trato amable a sus clientes. 
Pero lo difícil es que este tipo de transporte es muy común en su ciudad, por lo que cada día tiene que lidiar con la competencia, por tal motivo trata de usar su tiempo para otros negocios como apoyar a su esposa en la venta de ropa, de esta manera puede compensar las ganancias y sostener los gastos familiares.
Para el futuro, a Rider le gustaría tener una tienda de comestibles, pues es un negocio tranquilo y rentable.

Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, él es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Futuro Mejor” y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que todos son responsables y muy unidos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará algunos repuestos para mandar a repara su motocarro y con lo que le reste invertirá en el negocio de su esposa, comprando más prendas para la venta.
texts.en:
Rider is 37 years old, the father of four children, and he has been living with his partner for 16 years in one of his aunts' houses. For two years, he has been making a living by transporting passengers on his own motorcar. What he likes about his work is that he is able to meet many people and to have pleasant conversations. It is also very important to him that he treats his clients well. His biggest challenge is that this kind of work is very common in his city, so everyday he has to compete with others. For this reason, he is trying to dedicate his time to other businesses, like helping his wife sell clothes. This way, he can earn a profit and keep up with the family expenses. In the future, Rider would like to have a general store, because it would be a profitable and peaceful business. This is his second loan with MFP, he is part of the communal bank, “Futuro Mejor” and he likes that the members of his group are responsible and united. With the money he is now soliciting, he will buy a few replacement parts to get his motorcar fixed, and he will invest the rest in his wife's business, buying more clothes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for his motorcar

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a LAPO woman and has been a member for four years without any repayment defaults.  She is hair dresser.  Tina intends to expand her business and add fish selling.  The demand for fish is high. She has a deep freezer and can preserve the fish, but her main constraint is funding.  Tina requests a loan of N100,000 to purchase cartons of fish to sell to increase her profit and for business capital. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria sells fish in Delta State. She buys directly from fishermen, smokes them and sells to the public. Maria has been in this business for over twenty years and sustains her family with the profits.  She is a very hard worker and hopes to make more sales and maximize her profit to insure a better living for her children.  Maria hopes for loan of N100,000 to purchase more fish.

loans.use: Purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is a 49 years old, widowed mother of three children.  All are in school.  She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the western region of Ghana.  Most people practice farming or trade goods. Olivia is a trader of smoked fish. She sells at the market square in her community and supplies to retailers and food vendors. Olivia buys fish from nearby towns and has been in business for over 25 years.  She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Armandine

texts.fr: A. Armandine est née en 1984 à Hozin au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNTONDJI Clément, un chauffeur de camion, Armandine est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Armandine vit depuis trois ans avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Armandine n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de 4 ans que Armandine vend des chaussures de façon ambulante. C'est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin que Armandine va s'approvisionner. Armandine n'a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. En vue d'agrandir son activité et d'augmenter sa clientèle, Armandine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Armandine was born in 1984 in Hozin, in Benin.  Married to HOUNTONDJI Clément, a truck driver, she is the mother of three children who are all in school.  For three years, she has been living with her children and husband in the Minontchou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  The couple provides for the family jointly. Armandine has never been to school.  For four years, she has been selling shoes from place to place.  Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin, is where she goes to stock up.  She has never obtained an ALIDé loan before.  With the aim of enlarging her business and increasing her customer base, she's requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old, married and has six children.  All are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the western region of Ghana. 

She works to provide for her family. Mary is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar in her community and sells all kinds of local dishes. Mary has hired extra hands that work for her. She buys food stuffs such as maize, cassava, plantain, vegetables, etc. from nearby communities and has been in business for over 15 years.  Mary wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: Buy food items.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a fifty years old, married and a mother of ten children, all in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana.  Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities.  Salamatu is a trader. Her trade is in smoked fish. She sells at the market square in her community and also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys the goods from nearby towns.  Salamatu has been in business for over twenty years and requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Ccori Chuspa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “CCORI CHUSPA”, viven en la provincia de Urubamba, que se encuentra a una hora y media de la provincia del Cusco, la mayoría de ellos tienen un negocio independiente pero con actividades de trabajo similares.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad de Urubamba, una gran parte se dedica a la venta de ropas, comida, víveres, artesanía, etc. Los socios varones tienen moto-taxi que hace el servicio de transportes. Una de las socias de este banco se dedican a la venta artesanía (joyas, pulseras, huacos retratos, mantos, etc.), otras socias tienen tiendas de abarrotes donde venden arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Un socio es jardinero y tiene una granja donde cría animales (cuyes, gallinas, patos, pollos, etc.). Una socia tiene un restaurante donde vende comida (desayuno, almuerzo y cena). Otra socia tiene su taller de costura. 

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(El socio Edison no aparece en la fotografía porque pidió permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal por motivos de salud).
texts.en:
Our clients belong to the communal bank “CCORI CHUSPA .” They live in the Urubamba province, which is located an hour and a half away from Cusco province. The bank is made up of 11 members and the majority of them have their own independent, but similar, businesses. These group members balance their many domestic activities with retail in Urubamba city. A large portion of them make their living by selling clothes, food, supplies, handicrafts, etc. The male members have a moto-taxi, which they use for a transportation business. One of the women in this bank sells handicrafts (jewels, bracelets, painted ceramics, cloaks, etc.), other members have general stores where they sell rice, sugar, oil, etc. One member is a gardener and has a farm where he cares for animals (guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, etc.). One member has a restaurant, where she sells food (breakfast, lunch, and dinner). Another member has a tailoring studio. The members are soliciting this loan for working capital so that they can offer more products and increase their sales, in order to better the quality of life of their families. All the members appreciate and are thankful for the loan they are receiving through this system, and thus have themselves promised to make all their payments according to the agreed-upon schedule. (The member Edison is not in the picture, with permission from the directors of the communal bank, because of reasons of health)

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their products and improve their sales

loans.name: God Mercy Group

texts.en:
Alice C. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called, “God Mercy.”  She is 42 years old, married with 3 children ranging from 6 to17 years old and their educational levels are from kindergarten to 8th grade.

She is a high school graduate, but could not continue to university due to poverty, but decided to get into business.

Alice lives and works in the Old Road community, a community with both poor and middle class Liberians south of the capital (Monrovia, Liberia.)

Her business is her general goods.  She buys general goods like: rice, sugar, margarine, candles, and etc. from wholesalers and sells retail to residents of Old Road.

She has been running this business for 9 years, and hopes to improve the store in the future.  Alice presents her goods in a unique way, and talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.

She started by selling kerosene with LD125.00 that was given to her by her sister-in-law.  Alice needs this loan to purchase more goods like: rice, milk, sugar, candles and etc to improve business.  She dreams of giving her children a better education and a plot of land to build a house for their families.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like rice,milk,sugar,candles and etc to improve business.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El señor Juan Hernández, desde hace 20 años labora como mecánico, la mayor necesidad que se le presenta es el sector económicos ya que no tiene los recurso para poder comprar materiales del servicio que el ofrece y eso a logrado que se le disminuya su labores lo  cual afecta a su negocio y a su propia familia por que no le ajusta para la alimentación ; por otra parte se ve afectado por  las condiciones en las cuales labora  que no son seguras para su vida por que no costa con los suficiente seguridad , actualmente alquila el taller donde trabaja y sus sueños es poder comprarlo algún día, él inicio este pequeño negocio gracias al apoyo que le brindo su papá , anteriormente se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en la calles del mismo municipio , tiene una familia de cuatro hijos y su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos básicos de la casa como agua , luz entre otros. Comprara herramientas, necesarias para poder hacer bien su trabajo. agradece a la institución por hacer posible estas mejora para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan H. has worked as a mechanic for 20 years. The greatest challenge he is faced with is that he does not have the resources to be able to purchase materials for the service that he offers, and this has caused his work to decline, which affects not only his business but also his family, because there is less money for food. On the other hand, he is also affected by the conditions in which he works, which are not safe enough. Currently, he is renting the workshop where he works, and his dream is to be able to buy it some day. He started up this small business thanks to the support that his father provided him. Previously, he had sold fruit and vegetables in the streets of his municipality. He has a family of four children and a wife who works and helps him with basic domestic expenses, such as water and electricity, among others. With this loan, he will purchase the necessary tools to be able to do his job well. He thanks this institution for making possible these improvements to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools to provide a better service

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a fifty-five year old, married and a mother of six children, all in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana.  Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. She is a trader. Esther trades in food items such as vegetables, tin foods, etc. She sells goods on a table top at the market square in her community.  Esther buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over nineteen years and requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is thirty-two years old. She is married and has six children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Joyce is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She buys the goods from nearby communities. Joyce has been in business for two years and requests a loan to procure bags of flour and other bread baking ingredients in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: A. Angèle est née le 28 Novembre 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Angèle est mariée à GANSSOU Gildas et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Angèle vit avec ses enfants au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou depuis sept ans environs. C'est le conjoint qui supporte les charges de la famille. Angèle n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a onze ans de cela que Angèle vend des parfums, déodorants, laits corporels à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est à Missèbo, un marché du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Angèle s'approvisionne. Angèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa clientèle, Angèle sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Angèle was born on November 28, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to GANSSOU Gildas and is the mother of two children who are both in school. For about seven years, she has been living with her children in the Agbodjèdo district in Cotonou. The husband is the one providing for the family. Angèle has never been to school. For eleven years since then, she has been selling perfumes, deodorants, and body lotions at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She goes to stock up at Missèbo, a market in Bénin, and in Lomé in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. With the aim of bolstering her business and increasing her customer base, she's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, deodorants, and body lotions

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Trinidad 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Hilaria is the group coordinator of L. Trinidad and is currently looking forward to taking out her first loan with Esperanza International. She lives in hot, crowded Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic.

She currently owns a business where she sells sandals and purses. Her sandals are very popular in the community since they fit in with the current popular style. With the loan she will buy 10 pairs of sandals and a dozen purses for her customers to buy.

She looks forward to using the earnings to reinvest in her business and to fix up her house. It is her dream to live with less economic limitations and greatly appreciates the low interest rates that Esperanza offers along with their business advice. She thanks you all for being part of this dream!

loans.use: To buy 10 pairs of sandals and 12 purses

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a thirty-five year old married mother of three children.  All three of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Felicia is a trader. She deals in hardware materials, such as cement, nails, paint, iron rods, etc. She sells in a shop by the road side in her community. She buys the goods from nearby towns. Felicia has been in business for four years and requests a loan to procure all kinds of goods to scale up her business.

loans.use: To buy hardware

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa trades in smoked fish. She is 52 years old, married and has given birth to six children, who are all in school. She sells at the market square in her community and also treks to other communities to sell. Theresa buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over 30 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

Theresa lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Women Of Substance Group

texts.en:
Mama P.'s business is the sale of dry fish. She is 40 years old and married with five children between the ages of 8 and 25 years old and in Grades 4 to 12. She is a 1st grade drop-out herself due to poverty but decided to go into business. She started with 3000 Liberian dollars that were given to her by her husband. Mama lives and works in the Fiamah community – a very crowded community that is south of the Liberian capital, Monrovia.

Mama buys fish from the fishermen, dries them and sells them retail to residents of Fiamah. She sells good fish and speaks well to her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She has been running her business for 15 years and is hoping to switch to the sale of cloth in the future. Mama needs this loan to purchase more fish for her customers to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and of completing their unfinished house.

Mama P. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Women of Substance".

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Claudine

texts.fr: V. Claudine est née le 16 Juillet 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à MONBOLOHOUN Affissou, Claudine est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Claudine vit depuis onze ans de cela, au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. C'est Affisou qui assure les charges de la famille. Il y a trois ans de cela que Claudine vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, accompagnés de sauce) dans son quartier. Claudine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déja bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Pour renforcer son activité et augmenter la quantité de repas produite par jour, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Claudine sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
V. Claudine was born on July 16, 1967 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to MONBOLOHOUN Affissou, she is the mother of four children who are all in school. For eleven years, she has been living with her husband and children in the Avotrou district in Cotonou. Affissou is the one ensuring that family expenses are met. For three years, Claudine has been selling food (rice or cornmeal mash, served with sauces) in her district. She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who had three ALIDé loans before, which she has repaid. To bolster her business and to increase the quantity of meals produced per day, so as to satisfy her customers further, she's requesting a fourth ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice corn; drums of peanut oil; and sauce condiments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia trades in ready-made clothes such as shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc., for both gents and ladies. She is a 23-year-old married young woman with three children, all in school. She hawks clothes in her community and also treks to other communities to sell. Cecilia buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

Cecilia lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities.

loans.use: To buy ready-made wears

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a fifty-five-year-old married mother of seven children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Elizabeth is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys the goods from big supermarket stores in nearby towns. Elizabeth has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es:
La ude se le conoce con el nombre de “San Judas”, esta conformada por 6 integrantes, representada por la señora: Olga Lidia Gómez López. Ubicada en el Barrio San Sebastián, Municipio de Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas, México. El pueblo se caracteriza por una zona productora de café, maíz, cacao, plátano macho, naranjas, y otras variedades de frutas. También se dedican a la producción de ganado al pié de cría.

En este grupo esta la señora: Evanjelina Juárez Juárez, es originaria del municipio de Tecpatan, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con el Señor Juan Ramos Cuba, la Señora tiene un bebé de 13 meses de edad con el nombre de Juan Ramos Juárez, y con ellos vive un sobrino de 7 años de edad, quien esta cursando actualmente el segundo grado de primaria, ella se hizo cargo cuando tenía 4 años de edad.

Evanjelina Juárez Juárez, trabaja en su casa en la elaboración de manualidades como son: recuerdos para bautizo, bodas, cumpleaños, entre otros eventos, los materiales que utiliza son los siguientes: mantas, pinturas, encajes, foamy, listones, etc. Tiene 10 años realizándolo, ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo, tanto en las labores del hogar y a su bebé.

En esta ocasión ha solicitado a Fundaciòn Realidad A.C. un préstamo invertirá en la compra de materiales para elaborar las manualidades.

Nos narra la señora que las manualidades lo aprendió de su tía, y también a tomado cursos temporales en la capital de Chiapas, Tuxtla Gutiérrez, el ingreso que tiene de su negocio es del 50 % de su inversión, el cual una parte lo utiliza para la compra de material.

Considera que su negocio es especial, por que algunos lo aprendió de su abuela, como es el caso de las blusas típicas de la región, bordadas a mano, para esta actividad, utiliza el mejor material, de tal forma que el cliente se sienta a gusto con el articulo poseído.

Es una satisfacción muy grande la que siente cuando entrega sus productos, la felicitan, además; cuando recibe el pago se siente orgullosa por que contribuye con los gastos de la casa.
Ha logrado analizar que el factor mas grande que afecta su negocio es la ubicación, por que esta en la orilla del pueblo.  
 
Su aspiración es que mas adelante crezca su negocio, donde pueda generar empleo para otras mujeres que al igual que ella se superen, además, con los prestamos tiene pensado comprar maquinas que faciliten el trabajo, el mejorar su establecimiento y así tener un incremento en sus ventas.
De esta forma, apoyará a su hijo para que tenga lo necesario para poder realizar sus estudios, así también su sobrino quien ya forma parte directamente a su familia.
Después de todo, esta preparándose para después poder impartir cursos de manualidades, de tal manera que comparta sus conocimientos.

Las otras 5 mujeres que a continuación se mencionan también tienen su negocio, a excepción de la señora Olga Lidia Gómez López, quien iniciará la venta de zapatos, esa es su más grande aspiración. Patricia Juárez Domínguez, tiene un establecimiento de venta de cosméticos y ropa. Silvia Juárez Juárez, vende zapatos por catalogo. Rosa Maria López E., su esposo, baja todos los días muy de madrugada al rió para pescar, y después sea la señora Rosa Maria quien saque a venderlo en el Municipio. Erika Estrella M. C., elabora totopos de maíz con mantequilla para venderlo en el mismo municipio.
texts.en:
The bank known by the name "San Judas" is made up of 6 members, represented by Mrs. Olga Lidia G. L.. It is located in the neighborhood of San Sebastian in the municipality of Tecpatan in Chiapas, Mexico. The village features coffee producing, corn, cocoa, plantains, oranges and other fruit varieties. They are also involved in the production of breeding cattle. In this group is Mr.s Evanjelina J. J., who is a native of the Tecpatan municipality. She is 34 years of age, lives in a free union with Mr. Juan Ramos Cuba. The lady has a baby of 13 months of age whose name is John Ramos J.. She also has a nephew living with them of 7 years of age, who is currently enrolled in second grade. Evanjelina brought her into her home when she was 4 years old. Evanjelina J. J. works at home in the development of crafts such as souvenirs for baptism, weddings, birthdays, among other events. The materials used are blankets, paintings, lace, foam, ribbons, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years, allowing her to manage her time properly with household tasks and her baby. This time she has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to produce handicrafts. The lady tells us that she learned this craft from her aunt, and also took time courses in the capital of Chiapas, Tuxtla Gutiérrez. The income of her business is 50% of the investment, which is partly used to purchase equipment. She believes her business is special in that she learned some from her grandmother, as is the case with her typical regional blouses, embroidered by hand. She uses the best material, so that customers feel comfortable when the item is worn. She feels great satisfaction when she sells her products because she is proud when she receives payment as she is contributing to household expenses. She has managed to analyze the biggest factor affecting her business -- location, which is on the edge of town. Her aspiration is to grow her business later, where she can create employment for other women like her who can overcome their challenges. In addition, she intends to use the loan to buy machines to facilitate the work, improve her establishment and thus increase her sales. Thus, she can further support her child for what is necessary to carry out her studies, and also for her nephew who is already part directly to his family. She wants to then be able to offer courses in crafts, so as to share her knowledge. The five other women listed below also have their own business with the exception of Olga Lidia G. L., who will begin the sale of shoes, which is her greatest aspiration. Patricia J. D., has an establishment selling cosmetics and clothing. Silvia J. J., sells shoes through catalogs. Rosa Maria L. E. and her husband every go down to the river to fish very early, and then Mrs. Rosa Maria takes the fish and sells it in the market. Erika Estrella M. C. manufactures corn chips and butter to sell in the same municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for their crafts and fishing business

loans.name: Willingness Group

texts.en: Seeta D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Willingness. She is 29 years old, a single mother of two children aged 3 and 6 with nursery and kindergarten iii education levels. She is a senior student in college but decided to get into business. Seeta lives and works on 16th Street, Sinkor, south of the Liberian capital Monrovia. Her business is the sale of drinks. She buys items like soft drinks and mineral water from producers and retails to residents of 16th Street, Sinkor. She has been running this business for 5 years, and hopes to expand to a larger shop in the future. Seeta sells at an ideal location and sells at an affordable price in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. She started by selling with 3,000 LRD that was given to her by her fiance. Seeta needs this loan to purchase more soft drinks to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and providing shelter for them.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to improve her business

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Esperanza (Love and Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums surrounding Santo Domingo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and five children.

Yolanda is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used children's clothing by buying clothing in bulk at a good price. She will use the profits to improve her house with the dream of continuing to grow her business and to provide a good life for her family in a good house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy used children's clothing in bulk

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: S. Jeanne est née le 13 Janvier 1979 à Zè au Bénin. Jeanne est mariée à BIOKOU Affissou mais n'a pas encore d'enfant. Le couple vit ensemble au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économiqe du Bénin, depuis 4 ans. Seul le conjoint assure les charges de la famille. Jeanne n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a sept ans environs que Jeanne vend des tissus à Missèbo, un marché de friperies au Bénin. C'est à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, que Jeanne va s'approvisionner. Jeanne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour renforcer davantage son activité et mieux faire face à la forte demande de la clientèle à l'approche des fêtes, Jeanne sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Jeanne was born on January 13, 1979 in Zè, in Benin. She is married to BIOKOU Affissou but does not yet have any children. The couple has been living together for four years in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The husband is the only one ensuring that family expenses are met. Jeanne has not been to school. For about seven years, she has been selling cloth at Missèbo, a market for second-hand clothing and the like, in Benin. Lomé in Togo, a country neighboring Benin, is where she goes to stock up. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. To bolster her business more and to cope better with the strong customer demand, she's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lengths of cloth

loans.name: Segundo Telesforo

texts.es: El Sr. Segundo M. Fernández tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto su esposa la Sra. María La Rosa y sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos menores en edad escolar y dos mayores de edad. Cliente realiza la actividad de taxista para el distrito de Ocucaje  hace cinco años, además se dedica a labores de agricultura sembrando en terrenos propios en el caserío de El Tambo y Los Pecanos en Ocucaje contando para dicha labor con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos mayores. Actualmente está construyendo en su casa un módulo de vivienda para damnificados del terremoto por lo cual requiere de préstamo para solventar gastos de mano de obra y concluir con la construcción de dicho módulo. Son personas muy trabajadoras las cuales brindan educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretenden tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mr. Segundo M. F. is 41 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife, Mrs. Maria La Rosa, and their four children, of whom two are of school age and two are adults. Our client has been a taxi driver in the district of Ocucaje for five years. Additionally, he works in agriculture, planting seeds on his own land on the farm El Tambo y Los Pecanos in Ocucaje. He counts on his wife and his older children for help with this work. Currently, in his home he is constructing a housing unit for victims of the earthquake, for which he requires this loan, to settle the expenses of manual labor in finishing the construction. They are very hard-working people who put forth a lot of effort to provide their children with a good education and aspire to have a better quality of life. His dream is to be able to finish the construction on his house. Both he and his wife are grateful for the help we are providing them to make their dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing construction

loans.name: Edilberto Primitivo

texts.es: El Sr. Edilberto S. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, no tiene hijos menores, sus hijos laboran en fundos de la zona de Santiago. Labora desde hace 10 años como maestro panificador percibiendo ingresos semanales sin boletas de pago, su esposa labora como obrera de campo en la empresa Corporación Agrícola del Sur. Adicionalmente se dedican a la crianza de cerdos en su propio domicilio. Fueron afectados por el terremoto del año 2007 por lo cual con mucho esfuerzo han logrado reconstruir su casa con material de caña y adobe. Su sueño es poder llegar a construir su casa totalmente. Solicitan crédito para continuar con construcción progresiva de su casa. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar para lograr la reconstrucción de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Edilberto S. is 44 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife. His children are adults and work on large farms in the zone of Santiago. He has worked for 10 years as a master planner, receiving weekly income without pay stubs. His wife is a farmworker for the company Corporacion Agricola del Sur. Additionally, they raise pigs in their own home. They were affected by the earthquake in 2007, and with a lot of effort they managed to rebuild their house with cane and adobe. Their dream is to be able to completely build their house. They are requesting this credit to continue with the progressive construction of their house. Both of them are grateful for the support that we can provide them to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconstruction of their home

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is a thirty-seven-year-old married mother of four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. She is a trader. Emilia trades in food items such as rice, vegetables, tinned foods, etc. She sells on a tabletop at the market square in her community. She buys the goods from nearby towns. Emilia has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a thirty-five-year-old divorced mother of three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Yaa is a trader. She trades in game meat. She buys the smoked game meat from nearby communities and sells at the local market. Yaa says she also supplies to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy game meat

loans.name: Ataa

texts.en: Ataa is a 25-year-old single lady with no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Ataa is a hairdresser by profession. She works in a shop by one of the streets in her community. According to Ataa, she has three apprentices who are currently under training. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy working materials such as artificial hair, pomade, shampoo, etc. so she can improve her services.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair and other products for her salon

loans.name: Awaou

texts.fr: D. Awaou est née en 1955 à Agbato au  Bénin. Awaou vit depuis 54 ans au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DOHOU Patrice, Awaou est mère de six enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Awaou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Awaou n’a pas été à l’école. Pour aider son mari dans les charges de la maison, Awaou vend  des condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piment, etc.) de l’huile d’arachide, ainsi que de bois de chauffage à son domicile. Awaou a trente ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Awaou s’approvisionne. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est pour développer davantage son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Awaou sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
Madame D. was born in 1955 in Agbato in Benin. For 54 years she has lived in the Agbato neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Patrice Dohou and has six children, some of whom attend school. She lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple manages the family expenses. Madame D. did not go to school. From her home she sells condiments for sauce (tomatoes, onions, peppers etc.), as well as peanut oil and firewood in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She has 30 years' experience in this field. She stocks up in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is a former client of Kiva Field Partner, ALIDé, and she repays her loans without difficulty. Madame D. is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé in order to further develop her business and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments for sauce (baskets of tomatoes and peppers), cans of peanut oil and a truckload of firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions for her store

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: K. Jeanne est née en 1952 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est une veuve, ayant six enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Depuis 40 ans, Jeanne vit au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou. Jeanne vit seule et assure elle-même ses besoins. C’est depuis 20 ans que Jeanne vend des condiments de sauce (tomate, piments, légumes, etc.) et des divers (bonbons, biscuits, sucre, lait, savons, bougies, allumettes, etc.) à son domicile. Jeanne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue de renforcer son activité et de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Jeanne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne K. was born in 1952 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's a widow with six children, out of whom some attend school. For forty years, Jeanne has been living in the Agbodjèdo neighborhood in Cotonou. She lives alone and provides for herself on her own. For twenty years, she's been selling sauce condiments (tomatoes, chili pepper, vegetables, etc) and various items (candies, biscuits, sugar, milk, soaps, candles, matches, etc) at her house. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loan without problems. In order to bolster her business and meet customer demand, Jeanne is seeking her fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of tomatoes and chili peppers, candies, biscuits, sugar, milk, soaps, and cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive junto a su esposo, quien es mecánico de motores pesados y también se dedica a la venta de madera.
Desde hace 5 años Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, los cuales lleva de casa en casa por los distintos lugares su localidad, dejándolos al crédito o al contado.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con las personas, con quienes comparte momentos muy amenos, además le es rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y es por ello que sus clientes no dudan en requerir de sus productos. A pesar que esta labor es muy cansada porque tiene que caminar constantemente, Rosa se esfuerza porque quiere mejorar la economía de su hogar.

Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Futuro mejor” y le gusta mucho porque entre todos los integrantes se conocen y son responsables con sus trabajos y pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ropa para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
