Rosa is 37 years old, the mother of 4 children, and lives together with her husband, who is a motor mechanic and also sells wood. For the last 5 years Rosa has made a living by selling beauty products and clothing, which she takes from house to house in various places in her town, accepting credit or cash as payment. The thing she likes about her job is being in contact with people, with whom she shares very enjoyable moments. Furthermore, it is profitable for her, because she works for a very well-known brand of cosmetics. For this reason, her clients don't hesitate to buy her products. Even though this job is very tiring, since she has to walk constantly, Rosa puts forth a lot of effort because she wants to improve the financial situation in her home. This is her second loan with MFP. She is part of a communal bank called "Futuro mejor", and she likes it a lot, because all of the members know each other and are responsible with their jobs and payments. With the money that she is now requesting, she will purchase more beauty products and clothing to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 25 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. He works hard to be able to provide for himself. Isaac is a butcher. He slaughters and sells pork in his community. He sells on a tabletop at the local market to food vendors in particular. Isaac procures the live animals from nearby communities. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy more pigs to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Señor Justo Juez Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR JUSTO JUEZ”, ellos viven en la provincia D. Cusco. El banco comunal esta conformado por 13 socios y la mayoría de ellos tienen un negocio independiente pero con actividades de trabajo similares. La reunión de las socias se hace en el local de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades D. hogar con la venta de artesanía, víveres, cosméticos, materiales de construcción, granos, etc. Una gran parte tiene su propio de local de venta como una ferretería, un restaurante, un abarrote, etc. Dos socias son promotoras de ventas de productos a tiendas comerciales. La socia Hermelinda tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde venden arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Una de las socias tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida y ella prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena.      

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(El socio Washington no aparece en la fotografía porque pidió permiso a la junta directiva D. banco comunal por motivos de salud).
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “ Señor Justo Juez” community bank, and live in the province of Cusco. The community bank is made up of 13 members, the majority of whom have an independent business, but in similar fields. Members’ meetings are held in the local office of the Arariwa Association.

Our members alternate between household duties and the sales of handicrafts, food, cosmetics, building materials, bulk grains, etc. Many have their own sales location, such as a market, restaurant, grocery store, etc. Two members sell products to commercial stores. One member owns a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. Another member has a small stall where she prepares and sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

The members are seeking a loan that will be used for working capital. With this they will increase their product lines, generate more sales, and achieve a better quality of life for their families. They value and are grateful for this loan, and promise to complete the payments on schedule.

(One member does not appear in the photograph. He asked the board of directors of the community bank for permission to be excluded because of health reasons.)

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to increase sales

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, y con sus 2 hijos que están estudiando.
Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, los mismos que lleva a repartir a sus clientes en el motocarro de su esposo. Adicionalmente, hace 4 años Rosa tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles y bebidas en su vivienda, donde cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos  para la atención mientras ella está repartiendo los productos de belleza. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con las personas, con quienes comparte conversaciones muy amenas y hace muchas amistades; además le muy rentable porque trabaja para una marca cosmética muy reconocida y sus clientes no dudan en requerir de estos productos. 
Su deseo a futuro es convertir su bodega en un minimarket.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal, está muy acostumbrada a sus compañeros, a quienes aprecia mucho porque trabajar unidos y son bien organizados. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ropa, también incrementará los productos que vende en su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, lives with her husband, who is a public transport driver, and their two children, who are students. For the past year she has sold clothing and beauty products which she takes to her customers in her husband's motor vehicle. Also, for the past 4 years, Rosa has had a small grocery store in her home where she sells food items and beverages; her children help her tend to the customers at the store while she is out delivering her beauty products. What she most likes about her job is the contact she has with people with whom she has pleasant conversations and makes many friendships. Besides, it is profitable because she works for a very well-known cosmetics brand and her customers always require these products. Her wish for the future is to convert her small store into a minimart. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is a member of a communal bank and very accustomed to her fellow members, who she likes very much because they work well together and are very well organized. With the financing requested now she will buy more beauty products and will increase her supply of items sold in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Joyce is a hairdresser by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. Joyce says she has seven apprentices who are currently under training. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy working materials such as artificial hair, pomade, shampoo, etc. so can improve upon her services.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair and other products for her salon

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 40 años, vive junto a su esposo quien, es trabajador dependiente, y con sus 4 hijos.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida al paso pero por las noches, ella es muy buena preparando salchipapas (salchichas con papas fritas) y pollo broaster (pollo frito con huevo batido y papas fritas). Para ello, Roxana acondiciona un espacio afuera de su vivienda, pues está ubicada en una zona bastante transitada, por lo que tiene muchos clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es brindar una buena atención a sus comensales, para que se sientan satisfechos y regresen a su negocio. 
Su deseo a futuro es tener un restaurante especializado en la venta de pollo a la brasa, llamado “pollería”.  

Con MFP ya tiene 13 préstamos, es parte de un banco comunal y lo que le gusta es que sus compañeros son responsables y tienen una buena asesora de crédito que los incentiva a seguir adelante. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará nuevas mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina, en ello invertirá 1500 soles; con lo restante mandará a construir un local más adecuado para su negocio, donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Roxana, 40, lives with her husband, who is a sales clerk, and her four children. For the past 4 years she has sold prepared food from a sidewalk stand at night. She is very good at preparing salchipapas (sausages with fried potatoes) and pollo broaster (fried chicken with scrambled eggs and fried potatoes). To do this, Roxana equips a space outside her house because she is located in an area with lots of foot traffic so she has a lot of customers. What she most likes about her job is to provide good attention to her diners, so that they will feel satisfied and return. Her wish for the future is to have a restaurant specializing in the sale of roasted chicken, called “pollería”. She has had 13 previous loans with MFP and is a member of a communal bank. What she likes about it is that her fellow members are responsible and they have a good credit advisor that motivates them to continue forging ahead. With the funds requested on this occasion she will buy new tables, chairs and cooking utensils. She will invest 1500 soles in that; with the remaining money she will have a more adequate site built for her business where she will be able to better attend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and to build a site for her business.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.es:
Sheila tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando y son su mayor inspiración para progresar.
Desde hace 2 años cuenta con un espacio que adecuó en su vivienda para su negocio de distribución de golosinas y yogur. Sheila abastece con estos productos varias tiendas de abarrotes y personas que cuentan con un puesto en el mercado de su localidad.
Hasta ahora le va muy bien, porque gracias a su desempeño está consiguiendo lo que siempre anheló, ser una empresaria. Una de las cosas que más le gusta de su negocio en enseñar y guiar a las personas que trabajan para ella, especialmente los orienta para que brinden una buena atención a los clientes.

Con MFP ya tiene 15 préstamos, es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Futuro mejor”, donde está muy contenta porque entre todos se entienden y trabajan con responsabilidad. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, incrementará el stock de los productos que vende.
texts.en:
Sheila, 32, is a single mother; she has two school-age children, who are her greatest inspiration to continue to progress. For the past two years she has had a space in her home that she equipped to distribute sweets and yoghurt. She supplies several grocery stores and people who have stands in the local market with these products. To date, she has done very well because, thanks to her determination, she has gotten what she has always wished for: to be a businesswoman. One of the things she likes most about her work is to teach and guide the people who work for her especially in the area of customer service. She has had 15 previous loans with MFP and is a member of a communal bank called "Futuro Mejor" (A Better Future) where she is very happy because all the members understand each other very well and they all work responsibly. With the funds requested now she will increase her stock of items she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA ANTONIETA F. Y., tiene  26 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios superiores (incompletos) en educación ya que por falta de recursos económicos dejó los estudios para empezar a trabajar, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de pescado frito, ceviche , cervezas y gaseosas en su domicilio por las tardes, ya que en las mañana trabaja en el terminal pesquero de Buenos Aires.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar  platos, cubiertos y vasos para su negocio.
texts.en:
MARIA ANTONIETA F. Y., 26, lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II (Enterprising Women II) communal bank. She didn't quite finish secondary school for lack of funds to pay for studies and started working. She has a two-year-old son who is dependent on her. She sells fried fish, ceviche (raw fish marinated in lemon and garlic), beer and soft drinks in her home in the afternoons; during the mornings she works at the Buenos Aires fishing terminal. This is her first loan; she needs 300 new soles to buy dishes, cutlery and glasses for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dishes, cutlery and glasses.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: A. Elise est née le 11 Février 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elise est mariée à ADECHI Alim et est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Elise vit avec son enfant et son mari depuis 5 ans au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou. Seul Alim supporte les charges de la famille. Elise n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a quatre ans environs que Elise vend des tissus par le système de distribution. Elise est aussi une coiffeuse qui vend également des mèches. Elise fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C'est dans l'optique d'agrandir son stock de tissus afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Elise sollcite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Elise A. was born on February 11, 1975, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Alim ADECHI and the mother of one school-attending child. For five years, Elise has been living with her child and her husband in the Avotrou neighborhood in Cotonou. She supports the family on her own and she never attended school. For about four years, she's been selling fabrics by the distribution system. Elise is also a hairdresser who sells hair extensions. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to increase her stock of fabric to better meet customer demand, Elise is seeking her fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, y tiene 2 hijos que cursan estudios primarios, ella vive en la casa de su madre.
Desde hace 6 años brinda el servicio de costura de ropa, para ello implementó un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, que se ha convertido en su taller. 
Lo que más le gusta a Virginia de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos de su labor, además esta es una actividad rentable porque cuenta con una gama de clientes que aprecian su trabajo y la buscan regularmente.
Pero, definitivamente Virginia se siente limitada por no contar con un taller adecuado, donde pueda trabajar con mayor comodidad, y donde pueda recibir a sus clientes.

Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que son personas responsables y bien organizadas, y cuando hay inconvenientes se resuelven muy rápido. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una máquina para remallar y otra para recubrimientos, así podrá realizar un mejor acabado a las prendas que confecciona.
texts.en:
Virginia is 40-years-old and single with two children in primary school. She lives in a house with her mother. For the past 6 years she's been in business sewing clothing in a small area in her house, which she has converted into a sewing studio. What Virginia likes best about her work is her good relationship with her clients, who are happy with her work. In addition, business is profitable because she has a clientele who appreciate her work and use her services on a regular basis. However, Virginia definitely feels limited because she needs a more suitable studio where she can work in comfort and receive her clients. This will be Virginia's sixth loan with MFP. She is a member of a village bank and what she likes about her group is that they are responsible and well-organized, and when there's an issue, they resolve it very quickly. She plans to use her loan to buy machines for mending and overlays so she can apply better finish work to her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy machines for improving her tailoring

loans.name: Magda Luz

texts.es: Magda Reátegui es una persona perseverante y creativa, vive en distrito D. calleria región D. Ucayali, tiene 46 años y es madre D. cinco hijos, uno D. ellos es menor D. edad; ella se dedica a la confección y decoración D. vestidos, trabaja junto a su mamá, y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es electricista. Integra el Banco Comunal  “Las Divinas” desD. hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra y venta D. gaseosas. Ahora necesita un crédito D. 2300 soles que será invertido en productos para la decoración D. trajes típicos. La meta D. Magda es tener un local donD. pueda exhibir estos vestuarios, ya que ella los venD. y alquila.
texts.en:
Magda Reátegui is a very determined and creative woman. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is 46 years old and has five children (one is still underage). She works with her mom sewing and decorating dresses. She counts with the support of her husband who is an electrician. She has been a member of the communal bank “Las Divinas” for six years. The first loan she received was of 300 soles and it allowed her to invest in the purchase and resale of soft drinks. She now needs a loan of 2300 soles, which will be invested in products to decorate traditional clothing. Magda’s goal is to have a store where she can exhibit this clothing in order to rent and sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to decorate traditional clothing.

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr: S. Mouniratou est née le 18 Juillet 1967 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à DJANFAROU Ibrahim, Mouniratou est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mouniratou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Avrotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis sept ans. Seul Ibrahim assure les charges de la famille. Mouniratou n'a pas été à l'école. Depuis cinq ans environs, Mouniratou vend des tissus (bazins, hitarget, etc.) par le système de distribution. Mouniratou s'approvisionne dans une boutique des libanais à Cotonou. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement  et agrandir son activité, Mouniratou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mouniratou S. was born on July 18, 1967, in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She's married to Ibrahim DJANFAROU and the mother of four school-attending children. For seven years, Mouniratou has been living with her children and her husband in the Avrotou neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Ibrahim supports the family on his own. Mouniratou never attended school. For about five years, she's been selling fabrics (bazins, Hitarget, etc). She gets her supplies from a lebanese shop in Cotonou. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who already benefited from three loans, which were repaid without problems. To bolster her working capital and expand her business, Mouniratou is seeking her fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics (bazins)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda Guzmán es una mujer perseverante y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, venta de bebidas, y por las mañanas vende desayuno en su casa; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es comerciante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace siete años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que le permitirá invertir una parte en gaseosas y la otra en insumos para la elaboración de sus alimentos. La meta de Yolanda es llegar a tener un mini-market.
texts.en:
Yolanda Guzman is a hard-working and cooperative woman. She lives in the Calleria district of the Ucayali region. She is 46 years old and is mother to two teenage children. She makes clothes and sells drinks. In the mornings she sells breakfast from her house. She relies on her husband for help; he is a businessman. She has been a member of the Community Bank “Las Divinas” for seven years. The first loan she obtained was for 300 Peruvian soles which allowed her to buy fizzy drinks. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 soles which will allow her to spend a portion on fizzy drinks and the rest on ingredients with which to make her dishes. Yolanda’s goal is to own a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks to sell

loans.name: Heyly

texts.es:
Heyly es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 24 años, es soltera, ella tiene una bodega en su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de su prima. 
Heyly forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martin” desde hace dos años y 4 meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de gaseosas. 
Actualmente ella requiere un crédito de 900 soles, con el que comprará artículos para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, productos comestibles. La meta de Heyly es ampliar su negocio, tener una tienda comercial y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Hayly, 24, has been a dynamic, hard-working member of the "Fray Martin" communal bank for the last two years and four months. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region; she's single and runs a small grocery store in her home where her cousin helps her. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy soft-drinks. Hayly now needs a 900 sol loan to buy inventory items like: rice, sugar, pasta, food items, for her store. Her goal is to expand her business until she can have a commercial store and sell at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Nouratou

texts.fr: B. Nouratou est née le 24 Mars 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Nouratou est mariée à ADEKAMBI Sunday, un revendeur. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Nouratou vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, depuis sept ans. Nouratou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la maison. Nouratou a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Après cela, Nouratou a appris la coiffure et l'exerce depuis neuf ans de cela. Nouratou vend également des mèches et des produits pour cheveux dans son salon de coiffure situé à Adogléta à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Nouratou s'approvisionne. Nouratou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'agrandir son commerce, Nouratou sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Nouratou was born on March 24, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ADEKAMBI Sunday, a retailer.  The couple has three children who are all in school.  For seven years, she has lived with her children and husband in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou.  She helps her husband to meet household expenses.  Nouratou attended school through the secondary level.  Afterwards, she learned about hairstyling and has been working at it for nine years since then.  She also sells hair extensions and hair products in her salon located in Adogléta in Cotonou.  She supplies herself from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans.  To increase her working capital and to expand her commerce, she's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and products for hairstyling

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.en:
The "Mujeres Progresistas" (Progressive Women) group was formed in the city of JA Saldivar in July 2009 through the initiative of Ms. Basilisa A., who had participated in the program for Female Entrepreneurship before. She contacted her local entrepreneurship and microfinance counselor, and discussed continuing her work with Fundacion Paraguaya. She gathered 15 women, all of whom work comfortably together today and support each other in solidarity with their shared goals.  
The group's members use their loans to invest in their individual activities, such as selling food, haberdashery, goods, herbs, garlic, cleaning products, mandioca (cassava), cushions, fruits, etc. 
A particularly inspirational woman in this committee is Doña Felicita Pavon. Her story exemplifies the hard work that women in Paraguay put into their businesses and how female entrepreneurship makes a big difference in their lives and the lives of their families. Doña Felicita Pavon sells groceries to help her husband with family expenses. She has three children, all of school-age. Her husband has temporary jobs, but no stable, fixed employment or salary. 
Doña Felicita bakes small pies, makes sandwiches, patties and pastries to sell to her neighbors and workers who live and work in her community. Doña Felicita finds it very difficult to sustain and grow a business when she has such a high turn over rate - which is why the loan she receives from the Fundacion is so helpful. She can continually invest more into her business and let it grow and increase her profits. She also finds the help she receives from the Fundacion in terms of training and preparation, very helpful. The challenges faced by a poor family are very unique and need special attention. 
All committee members help each other to reach their common goals to better their livelihoods and achieve prosperity - the same goals as the Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda Gómez es una mujer carismática y emprendedora, vive en el distrito D. calleria región D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años D. edad, es madre (separada) D. ocho hijos, se dedica a  la confección D. prendas D. vestir.  Paralelamente brinda servicio D. alquiler D. cuartos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desD. hace nueve años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en telas para confeccionar sábanas. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra D. telas e hilos para confeccionar juegos D. sabanas y luego venderlas. 
La meta D. Erlinda es tener más cuartos para alquilar ya que tiene un terreno amplio en donD. hacer cuartos para más clientes.
texts.en:
Erlinda Gómez, 58, is a charismatic and enterprising woman who lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is separated and has 8 children. She is a seamstress but also has some rooms she rents. She has been a member of the "Juntas hasta el final" (Together until the end) communal bank for the last nine years. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy fabric to make bed sheets. Currently, she needs a 2000 sol loan to buy fabric and thread to make sets of bed sheets to sell. Erlinda's goal is to have more rooms to rent since she has a spacious lot on which to make more rooms for customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make bed sheet sets.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” del distrito D. Azángaro D. la Región Puno; tiene 64 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos D. los cuales 2  están a su cargo.  Estudió hasta el 1er grado D. primaria.
Consuelo  viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 meses, su préstamo inicial fue S/. 500.00 (nuevos soles) el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. pasamanería.
En la actualidad requiere D. un préstamo D. S/. 600.00 (nuevos soles), el cual le permitirá comprar ahujas, hilos,palillos, pasadores, etc.
Su mayor deseo es progresar y aumentar su capital D. trabajo. 
Referente a su Banco Comunal, ella manifiesta que le gusta la puntualidad y responsabilidad D. las socias.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 64, is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” communal bank, which is located in the Azángaro district, Puno region. She is married and has 6 children, of whom two are still under her care. She finished first graD.. She has been cooperating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 5 months. Her initial loan was for 500 new soles which she used to capitalize her decorative fringe-making business. Currently she is needing 600 new soles to buy needles, thread, pins, safety-pins, etc. Her greatest desire is to get ahead and increase her working capital. With respect to her communal bank, she states that she likes the punctuality and sense of responsiblity of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials used to make decorative fringe.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
La señora LUCERO T. V., tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to  de secundaria, es conviviente y  tiene 2 hijOs quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de menús, gaseosas y cervezas en su casa.  Con sus primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró arroz, azúcar, papas, fideos, carne, pollo, etc. para la preparación de sus menús (alimentos).
Con su próximo crédito de 1,200 nuevos soles, comprará cajas de cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor para estar abastecida por las  fiestas de fin de año.
LUCERO sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener un bar – restaurante para así aumentar sus ingresos y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
LUCERO T. V., 25, lives in the BUENOS AIRES district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II (Enterprising Women II) communal bank. She finished 10th grade, lives with her life partner, and has two children who depend upon her for support. She sells prepared meals, soft-drinks, and beer in her home. She used her first, 300 new sol loan, to buy rice, sugar, potatoes, pasta, meat, chicken, etc. for her meal preparation. With her next 1,200 new sol loan she will buy cases of beer and soft-drinks at wholesale so that she can be well-stocked for the end-of-year festivities. LUCERO dreams with expanding her business into a restaurant-bar in order to increase her earnings and provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beer and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Celia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Celia  es socia del Banco Comunal  “Azangarinas Valientes “ del distrito y provincia Azangaro, tiene 47 años de edad es conviviente  y tiene 02 hijos, ella estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria, viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, se dedica a la artesanía, específicamente tejidos a mano y máquina.

Celia dice que  el primer préstamo  fue de s/300.00 nuevos soles con los cuales adquirió su material para la elaboración de sus tejidos, así mismo arregló algunas inperfecciones que tenia  su máquina.

Ella requiere un credito de s/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que comprará mas  material y accesorios para su máquina; Piensa instalar un un pequeño taller para trabajar con mas tranquilidad y que sus trabajos sean de mayor calidad .

Su deseo  para el futuro es de construir y ampliar su casa ya que tiene dos hijos.

Lo que mas le agrada de su Banco Comunal son las charlas y el diálogo con sus compañeras
texts.en:
Celia, 47, is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Azangaro . She lives with her life partner and has two children. She finished fifth grade and has been cooperating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 3 years. She is a craftsperson specializing in hand- and machine-made knitted items. Celia tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol loan, to buy materials and supplies needed for her knitting as well as to make some repairs to her knitting machine. She now needs a 1500 new sol loan to buy more materials and attachments for her machine. She intends to install a small workshop so that she can work with more tranquility and her finished items will be of a higher quality. Her future desire is to build and enlarge her house because she has two children. What she most enjoys about her communal bank are the chats and the dialogue with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and attachments for her machine.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.en: The Women's Committee (Mujeres Solidarias) was formed on November 15, 2006. The initiative of Aida Luz R., who sells jewelry, brought 16 women together after contacting the local counselor on female entrepreneurship. This group is in their 10th loan cycle, working successfully and supporting each other in their enterprises.  The average loan in the group is Gs 1,005,263 per member, used for various sales activities such as food, haberdashery, goods for the pantry, clothes, fruit, cakes, and jewelry, and the operation of a kiosk selling rice, sugar, noodles, milk, bakery, etc.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Central, estudio educación Primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino para engorde los mismo que los venderá en las feria de la zona, actividad que realiza una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es hacer estudiar a sus hijos y continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the San Pedro Communal Bank which is located in the community of Ancara, Ilave District, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children. Juana lives in the community of Central Ancara and completed her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1½ years. Her first loan of 500 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling sheep.

Juana is requesting a new loan of 500 soles so that she can buy additional sheep for fattening, similar to the ones she sold at the regional fair. She goes to market once a week. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with an education and continue working. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania is 23 years old, single, and has been operating a wholesale grocery store called "Proveedora JRM" (JRM Supplier) for three years. At the store, she sells soda, juice, energy drinks, rum, and other drinks. Tania is a very hard worker and she spends her mornings at a technical school where she is studying to become a systems engineer; she only has three semesters to complete. Tania's father died when she was young, so she began working from a very young age. In the past she has worked as a waitress and at other grocery stores, but now she has her own.

With this loan, Tania will invest in additional merchandise to expand the quality and quantity of product available at her store. This way she will be able to grow her earnings. Tania dreams of finishing her studies and beginning a professional career, all the while helping to care for her mother as her mother ages.

loans.use: Purchase goods for grocery store

loans.name: Serigne Ckeikh Mbacke

texts.fr: Monsieur D. est un frigoriste qui travaille dans la réparation vente de réfrigérateur qu'il achète dans les conteneur en provenance de l'étranger. cette activité lui permet d'avoir quelques revenus pour s'occuper de sa petite famille.ce prêt va entrer dans le renforcement et l'acquisition de nouveaux matériaux  destinés à son travail
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a refrigeration specialist who works in repairing refrigerators, which he buys from the containers arriving from abroad.  This business allows him to have some income to take care of his small family.  This loan is going into bolstering his supplies and equipment and acquiring new ones for his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and sell refrigerators

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es:
La Señora Eustaquia P.  tiene 55 años y está casada con el Señor Faustino G.  por más D. 30 años, La señora se dedica a la producción D. leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clases D. productos lácteos, y su esposo además D. ayudar con la producción D. leche también se dedica a la agricultura y a cultivar la mayoría D. los insumos que utiliza para el ganado lechero, como ser chala, alfa alfa y  maíz.

La señora Eustaquia  vive en la zona D. Machac Marca en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada D. la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca D. préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa D. ir a esta zona y descubrimos que el estado en el que tienen su ganado no es muy bueno y que a la mayoría les falta establos, que en esta época D. lluvia son muy requeridos.Por lo tanto la señora Eustaquia utilizara este crédito para construir un establo y que sus vacas no sufran en la época D. lluvia. 

La señora Eustaquia nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción D. leche como siempre lo hizo, ver a sus hijos y nietos tener un futuro bueno y que algún día tenga suficiente ganado para dejarles una herencia a sus hijos que les ayuD. en la vida. Que cada vez está más dura en el país.
texts.en:
Eustaquia P., 55, has been married to Faustino G. for over 30 years. She is a dairy farmer and sells the milk to an enterprise that produces all kinds of dairy products. Her husband, asiD. from helping with the milk production, also farms and produces most of the feed, like chala (corn husks and cobs), alfalfa and corn, needed for the dairy cows. Eustaquia lives in the Machac Marca area of Cochabamba. This is an area that is quite far from the city so for them to go to banks in search of financing is very difficult. This is why Cidre took the initiative to go to this area and we discovered that the conditions in which they have their cattle are not very good; most lack stable facilities which in this rainy season is very much needed. Therefore, Eustaquia will use these funds to build a stable so that her cows won't suffer during the rainy season. Eustaquia tells us that her greatest wish is to continue with milk production like she's done to date, to see her children and grandchildren have a better future, and to someday have enough cattle to leave her children an inheritance that will help them in life, which every day is more difficult in the nation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a stable to house cattle.

loans.name: Naranjaisy Group

texts.en:
The Naranjaisy committee was formed on 10 October 2008, and consists of 28 women in the City of Villeta. This group was formed thanks to Ms. Dolores Hawk, who approached a local counselor to find out about the Women’s Entrepreneurs Program. She became very excited and very anxious to work with this program and is now very happy working in her fifth Group loan cycle.

The average credit given to the committee is Gs.639.000 per member. The members of this group use their allocated credit for different activities such as purchasing fruits and vegetables, ingredients for food preparation, dry goods, goods for the pantry (sugar, rice, grass, bakery, dairy, meat , etc.), supplies for jobs in manicure and pedicure, hair accessories, etc.

It is a very active group, with all members demonstrating solidarity and fellowship and attending weekly meetings and fundraising activities conducted for the common good of the group. It is one of the best groups working with the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, as all the members have remained together since the beginning.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.en:
In 2008, thanks to the current General Director of Comité Renacer, Ms. Laura R., this women’s committee was formed.  She took the initiative, and went to the local credit counselor to find out how the Women's Entrepreneurship program worked.  She gathered 21 women and they have been working together ever since. 

The average loan per member is 685,000 Gs., used for different activities such as selling food, selling dry goods, selling goods for the pantry (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy, bakery, etc.), selling clothes, selling cosmetics, photocopies, blankets and quilts, plants and gardening supplies.  The women of the committee are all working together, helping each other to reach their common goals. 

It's a very supportive group, and they have worked hard to make sure they all repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cristo Vive 1 Group

texts.en: Maria lives in Samana and wants to use the loan to improve her house and to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. She has five children and wants the best for them. She trusts Esperanza International to give her an opportunity to improve her future. Help us to help her.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Santa Marta Group

texts.en:
The Santa Marta Women’s Committee was formed on the 21st of August 2008 thanks to its former Director Marcia L., who herself sells dry goods.  When Ms. L. contacted the counselor at a weekly meeting in her area to find out more about the Women’s Entrepreneurship program she brought together 15 women, all of whom have worked together ever since, and are now in their 5th loan cycle together.

The average credit drawn by each member is 680,000 Gs., which is used for different activities, such as the sale of food, dry goods, cakes and other pastries, lingerie, beverages, cosmetics, clothes, candy, and the cultivation and sale of pigs, etc.

All of them perform fundraising activities, help each other reach their common goals of growing their business and repaying their loans on time.

They actively participate in weekly meetings and have impeccable work solidarity.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda tiene 44 años, vive junto a su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente, y con sus 3 hijos que son estudiantes.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de embutidos (chorizos, salchichas, jamonadas entre otras variedades) y productos lácteos (yogur y queso), los cuales lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su localidad, dejando al crédito o al contado a sus clientes
Adicionalmente, en su vivienda cuenta con 6 habitaciones que alquila desde hace un año atrás, y  esto hace para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchos lugares y relacionarse con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una lista de clientes regulares que le hacen pedido de sus productos constantemente.
Para el futuro, le gustaría implementar en su casa un ambiente para vender zapatos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y se siente muy a gusto porque todos sus compañeros son personas responsables. Amanda invertirá el 50% del dinero que ahora solicita en su negocio de venta de embutidos y productos lácteos; con la otra parte mandará a refaccionar algunas de las habitaciones que alquila en su casa.
texts.en:
Amanda, 44, lives with her husband, who is a salesclerk, and their three children, who are students. For the last two years she has sold cured meats {chorizo (cured pork sausage, flavoured with paprika), sausages, ham for sandwiches, among other varieties} and dairy products (yoghurt and cheese) which she takes to the various areas of the city to sell, both for cash and credit, to her customers. In addition, her house has six rooms which she has rented for the last year; she does this to help her husband defray household expenses. What she likes most about her job is to get to know various places and people. Besides, it's profitable because she has a list of regular customers who always place orders with her. For the future, she would like to set up a space in her home to sell shoes. This is her first loan with MFP. She is a member of a communal bank and is very comfortable there because all her fellow members are responsible persons. Amanda will invest half of the money in her cured meats sales and will use the other half to refurbish some of the rooms she rents in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and refurbish rental rooms.

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco tiene 24 años, vive junto a su pareja y madre de su pequeña hija de 2 años.
Desde hace un año implementó en su casa un pequeño almacén donde tiene su negocio de distribución de cervezas. Franco se decidió por esta actividad a razón de vivir cerca de varios bares, a quienes abastece de su producto.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tener una buena relación con sus clientes, además le es rentable porque la cerveza tiene buena demanda, así como también vende a las personas que realizan eventos los fines de semana.
A Franco le gustaría tener en el futuro una discoteca, pues en la zona donde vive es un negocio muy rentable.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y le gusta  trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros le inspiran confianza y todas son personas muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más cervezas para seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Franco is 24 years old and lives with his partner, who is the mother of his 2-year-old daughter. A year ago, he developed a small warehouse in his house where he has a beer distribution business. Franco decided on this business because he lives close to various bars who stock his product. What he likes even more about his job is that he has a good relationship with his clients. Additionally, the business is profitable because beer is in high demand, and he also sells to people who have events on weekends. Franco would like to own a nightclub in the future, which is a profitable business in the area where he lives. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP and he wants to work with a communal bank because the other members give him confidence and all the members are good workers. With the money that he is requesting, he will purchase more beer to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional merchandise

loans.name: Mildred

texts.es:
Mildred tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y vive con la última de sus 3 hijas, quien ya es mayor de edad y trabaja.
Desde hace 5 años tiene un pequeño kiosko afuera de su casa donde vende bebidas y golosinas. Su horario de atención es de 2 de la tarde a 9 de la noche.
Mildred está muy satisfecha con su negocio, y lo que más le gusta es poder brindar a sus clientes una buena atención para que siempre retornen a comprar sus productos, pues ella es una persona muy carismática y jovial.
Una de las ventajas de su negocio es que está ubicada en una zona por donde transitan muchas personas, por ello siempre tiene buenas ventas.
Por ello, para el futuro quiere lograr instalar un restaurante en su vivienda.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y lo que más le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que se trabaja en unión y sus compañeros son muy responsables con sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá  en la compra de más productos para surtir su kiosko.
texts.en:
Mildred is 46 years old, a single mother, and lives with the last of her three daughters, who is already adult and working.

For the last 5 years she has had a small kiosk outside her house where she sells drinks and sweets. Her schedule is from 2 in the afternoon until 9 at night.

Mildred is very happy with her business, and what she likes best is to be able to offer her customers good service so that they will always return and buy her products. She is a very charismatic and jovial person.

One of the advantages her business has is it's location in a zone where many people walk by, resulting in good sales. For this reason, in the future she would like to install a restaurant in her home.

This is the first credit she has requested with MFP and what she likes most about being part of a community bank is working in union with companions who are very responsible about their payments. The money she is soliciting will be invested in purchasing more products to add to her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE FOR HER KIOSK

loans.name: Odias

texts.es:
Odias tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, pero tiene a su cargo a su madre y a su hermana.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, gracias a que con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar su propio motocarro, ahora tiene dos, y el otro lo maneja chofer particular.
La encargada de recibir las ganancias de ambos motocarros y administrarlas es su esposa, quien es su mano derecha en este negocio.
Sin embargo, es tan grande su anhelo de progreso de Odias que en algunos momentos libres también se dedica a la venta de ropa en compañía de su esposa, estas prendas las llevan a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona y las dejan al crédito o la contado.
A Odias le gusta su trabajo, porque lo mantiene activo durante todo el día y obtiene ingresos diarios.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, es parte de un banco comunal y aunque es un grupo nuevo, ha notado que son personas responsables y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar sus motocarros, para que sigan laborando bien ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
Odias is 30 years old, and lives with his wife. He does not have children, but he is responsible for his mother and sister. For 4 years he has been in the business of transporting passengers. Thanks to a lot of hard work, he managed to buy his own motocar (light, 3-wheeled vehicle.) Now he has two, one of which is driven by a private driver. His wife, who is his right hand in the business, is in charge of receiving and handling the earnings from both of the motocars. Odias' desire to advance is very strong; in his few free moments he also sells clothing along with his wife. They take these garments to sell in various places in the area, and they sell on a cash and credit basis. Odias likes his work, because it keeps him busy all day and he gets daily earnings. This is his first loan with MFP. He is part of a communal bank, and although it is a new group, he has noted that they are hardworking and responsible people. With the money that he requests, he will buy spare parts to repair his motocars, so that he can continue to work well without any difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his motocars

loans.name: Yuvicsa

texts.es:
Yuvicsa tiene 18 años, es soltera, estudia la carrera de contabilidad y vive con sus padres.
Desde hace 3 años cuenta con dos departamentos ubicados en un espacio del terreno donde está la casa de sus padres, los cuales los alquila.
Este negocio es muy rentable, porque obtiene ganancias seguras todos los meses, además trata en lo posible de que sus inquilinos se sientas muy cómodos.
Yuvicsa está ahorrando dinero para que posteriormente pueda implementar un centro de llamadas telefónicas, pues este también es un negocio  muy rentable, pues todas las personas necesitan comunicarse con frecuencia.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal llamado “Los luchadores” y está muy contenta porque sus compañeros son personas responsables y organizadas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a refaccionar algunas estructuras de las habitaciones de los departamentos que alquila.
texts.en:
Yuvicsa is 18 years old, single, studies accounting, and lives with her parents. She began renting two apartments 3 years ago on part of the land where her parents house is located. This business is very profitable, because she earns guaranteed profits every month. Additionally, she tries as much as possible to make sure her tenants feel very comfortable. Yuvicsa is saving money so she can later set up a call center, which is also a very profitable business since everyone needs to communicate often. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP and she is part of a communal bank named "The Fighters". She is very happy because the other members are responsible and organized. With the money she is requesting, she will refurbish some of the structures in the rooms in the apartments she rents.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment of some structures in the rented apartments

loans.name: Creativas 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the group coordinator for Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women), a village bank of HOPE (one of Kiva's field partners) located in the northern part of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. She is wanting to take out her 4th loan with Esperanza International.

She lives in a poor area with poor drainage, sewage, electricity, and water infrastructure. The house, where she lives with her three children and another young girl, who is the orphaned daughter of her former neighbor, is maD. of cement block and roofed with tin sheets.

Maritza owns a small restaurant in this house where she sells snacks and breakfast to the nearby factory workers and everyday people who happen to pass by. Using this loan from Esperanza International, she is planning to buy rice, beans, flour, potatoes, plantain, oil, greens, and meat to begin selling lunch as well. She is currently fixing her leaky roof, clearing out a room, and saving to buy a table so that her clients can stay to eat their food instead of taking it to go. Maritza expects that this homely atmosphere will attract many more customers.

She has enjoyed working with Esperanza so far and really appreciates the low interest rates that make it possible to make the repayments on time and still leave her with enough money to pay for her children´s food and education. Thank you for helping her dream become a reality!

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, beans, meat, oil

loans.name: Rosa Gerardina

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cisne se encuentra en la  hermosa parroquia El Valle al  suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción agrícola como maíz, papas, etc., sus atractivos turísticos como la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentra llena de totoras (plantas para hacer esteras, sombreros, adornos), la colina de Tasqui que nos brinda una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de entera y su gente muy cálida y amable.
 
La señora Rosa L. es una de las socias fundadoras de éste banco, ella vive en la comunidad  San Miguel en la parroquia el Valle en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión matrimonial procreó cinco  hijos de 18, 16, 14, 5, 1 año, su primer y tercer hijo estudian en el colegio Técnico Salesiano,  su segunda hija se graduó en una academia de corte y confección ya trabaja y aporta económicamente para los gastos de la casa, su penúltimo hijo estudia en el jardín de infantes San Miguel. Su esposo trabaja como albañil profesión que le ha permitido salir adelante con su familia, lo más gratificante del esfuerzo de su trabajo es tener su casa propia.

Rosa trabaja criando animales como pollos, chanchos y cuyes hace  ya varios años, sus animales los vende en su comunidad y en las ferias de la localidad, lleva 19 ciclos trabajando con la fundación y los créditos obtenidos le han  beneficiado tanto en su hogar  como en su  negocio, con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar más pollos y cuyes que son de rápido crecimiento así como alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es ir incrementando poco a poco otros animales para su criadero y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The Swan Communal Bank is located in the beautiful parish of El Valle in southwestern Cuenca. This area is famous for its agricultural production of corn, potatoes, and other crops. Tourist attractions such as the Cochapamba Lagoon are filled with reeds used for making mats, hats, and decorations. Tasqui Hill provides a beautiful view of the parish and the entire city of Cuenca. The people are very warm and friendly.

Sra. Rosa L. is one of the founding members of this Communal Bank. She lives in the community of San Miguel in the El Valle Parish of Cuenca. She is 32 years old, married, and has 5 children ranging in age from 1 to 18. Her two oldest sons (the first and third children) are students at the Salesiano Technical School. Her oldest daughter (the second child) graduated from a sewing academy and now works in order to contribute to the household expenses. The second youngest child attends kindergarten in San Miguel. Her husband works as a bricklayer, which has helped her family get ahead. The most gratifying result of her hard work is being able to own a home.

Rosa raises animals such as chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She has been engaged in this business for several years and sells her animals in the community and at local fairs. Rosa has worked with the Foundation on 19 previous loan cycles. The funding she has received has benefited her home and her business. With this new loan, she will buy more chickens and guinea pigs since they grow faster. She will also purchase feed for the animals. Her goal is to gradually increase the number of other animals that she raises so that her family can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and feed

loans.name: Fose Kapwa Group

texts.en:
The “Fose Kapwa” Group is made up of twenty male and female entrepreneurs. After hearing so many good things from other business owners in neighboring towns, the group is excited to receive their loans. Yfonia V. is one of four representatives of the group. She is a single mother of two children, 10 and 13 yrs old.

This hardworking mom sells used clothing, men and women’s footwear, and suitcases, which she normally buys in the big city, Cap Haitien, to sell in various surrounding semi-rural communities. She is looking forward to being better able to provide for her family. Yfonia dreams of one day having a boutique and being able to build a home with the increased profits from her business.

On behalf of Yfonia, Fose Kapwa, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, sandals and suitcases to sell

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
El banco comunal María Reina de la Paz se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca, ésta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por su bella arquitectura, sus  hermosos templos,  los cuatro ríos que bañan ésta urbe  y las hábiles  manos de sus artesanos, además por su gente cálida y amable como nuestras socias que viven en diferentes áreas  de la urbe cuencana.

María Juana B. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad  en  el sector de Totoracocha, tiene  39 años de edad, es casada y tienen  cuatro hijos de 23, 16, 13,11 años, su primera hija se encuentra casada y vive independiente, su segundo y tercer hijo estudian  en el colegio Antonio Ávila y su último hijo en la escuela Benigno Astudillo, su esposo trabaja como comerciante en un negocio familiar, aún no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros.

María es comerciante vende todo tipo de electrodomésticos, lleva seis  años en esta actividad  junto a su esposo, el local es propio pues está ubicado en su casa lo que le permite ahorrarse el arriendo e invertir en la compra de otros productos para su negocio.

Nuestra socia trabaja desde seis años con su banco comunal  y nos comenta que los préstamos obtenidos siempre invierte en su  negocio, con el nuevo crédito solicitado a la  FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR va a comprar sanducheras, licuadoras, wafleras, batidoras, etc. para incrementar su negocio para la época navideña.

 Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “María Reina de la Paz” was established in the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. It is renowned for its beautiful architecture, exquisite temples, the four rivers that converge near the city, and the skillful hands of its artisans. In addition, the people are warm and friendly, just like our members who live in different area of Cuenca.

María Juana B. is a member of the María Reina de la Paz Communal Bank. She lives in the section of Cuenca called Totoracocha. She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children ranging in age from 11 to 23. Her oldest daughter is married and living independently. The next two children are students at Antonio Ávila High School. The youngest child attends the Benigno Astudillo School. Her husband works as a merchant in the family business. She and her husband do not own a home since they live with her in-laws.

María sells different types of electrical appliances. She has been in this business for six years and works with her husband. María has her own store located in her home, which allows her to save on rent and invest in other products for her business. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for six years and says that she always invests her loans in her business. This new loan with Fundación ESPOIR will be used to buy sandwich makers, blenders, waffle irons, mixers, and other appliances so that she can generate more sales during the Christmas season. María dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandwich makers, blenders, waffle irons, mixers, and other appliances for the Christmas season

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cisne se encuentra en la  hermosa parroquia El Valle al  suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción de maíz, papas, etc., sus atractivos turísticos como la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentran llena de totoras (plantas para hacer esteras, sombreros, adornos), la colina de Tasqui que nos brinda una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de Cuenca y su gente cálida y amable aque atrae al turista nacional y exranjero.

La señora María Carmen N. es una de las socias fundadoras  del banco Comunal El Cisne pues ya lleva  19 ciclos, ella vive en la comunidad San Miguel una parroquia de El Valle, tiene 37 años hace siete enviudó  y se quedó  con sus cinco hijos  que ahora tienen  20, 17, 14,11 y 9 años, de ellos su hija mayor se caso y vive independiente, el segundo de sus hijos trabaja y aporta con los gastos de la casa ya que sus otros hijos aún son estudiantes de primaria y secundaria, la casa en la que habitan es propia producto del esfuerzo y sacrificio de su juventud.

María es comerciante de leche  lleva quince años en esta actividad,  su producto reparte en el centro de la urbe cuencana, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos por su rápido crecimiento.

Con el crédito solicitado a ESPOIR va a comprar crías de pollos y alimento su crecimiento así  como invertir una parte en su negocio de leche, su meta es incrementar poco a poco sus dos  negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Cisne is located in the beautiful parish El Valle in the south east of the city of Cuenca, famous for its production of corn, potatoes, etc, its tourist attractions like the Cochapamba Laguna which is full of bulrushes (plants used to make mats, hats and decorations), the Tasqui hill which offers a beautiful view of the parish and the city of Cuenca and the warm and friendly people who attract domestic and foreign tourists.

Mrs. Maria Carmen N. is one of the founding members of El Cisne communal bank which has had 19 cycles. She lives in the San Miguel community, a parish of El Valle. She is 37 years old, she has been a widow for 7 years and she has 5 children who are now 20, 17, 14, and 11 and 9 years old. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently, her second child works and contributes to the household expenses and her other children are still students in primary and secondary school. Their house is a product of her efforts and sacrifice of her youth.

Maria has been selling milk for 15 years; she distributes her product in the center of Cuenca. She also raises quick growing chickens.

With this loan requested from ESPOIR, she is going to buy young chickens and nurture their growth as well as invest part of the money in her milk business. Her goal is to increase her two businesses little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young chickens and food for them

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es: Rosalva M. es una socia dinámica y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 25 años, madre de dos menores, Rosalva trabaja en la venta de bebidas refrescantes, actividad que lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica al transporte público,. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en su casa. Actualmente Rosalva necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado en la compra de gaseosas y néctares. La meta de Rosalva es  ser distribuidora de gaseosas y tener una bodega implementada con todo tipo de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Rosalva M. is a very dynamic and active woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 25 years old and the mother of two young children. Rosalva sells soft drinks from her house. She counts with the support of her husband who works with public transportation. She has been a member of the communal bank “Las Divinas” for two years. The first loan she received of 300 soles was used to buy candies to sell from her house. This time, Rosalva needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be used to purchase soft drinks and juice nectars. Rosalva’s goal is to become a distributor of soft drinks and to have a store with all kinds of food and beverage products.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and juice nectars.

loans.name: Melida Narcisa

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cisne se encuentra en la  hermosa parroquia El Valle al  suroeste de la Ciudad de Cuenca, siendo famosa por su producción de maíz, papas, etc., sus atractivos turísticos como la laguna de Cochapamba que se encuentra llena de totoras (plantas para hacer esteras, sombreros, adornos), la colina de Tasqui que nos brinda una hermosa vista de la parroquia y de la ciudad de Cuenca y su gente muy cálida y amable que nos hacen sentir como en casa son atractivos para los turistas.
 
Melida L. es una de las  socia activas de éste banco, lleva dos año trabajando con su banco comunal,  vive en la comunidad de Chilca totoras en el sector El  Valle, tiene 28 años de edad es casada y tienen una hija de 11 año que estudia en la escuela Dolores J. Torres de la localidad, su esposo vive  en el exterior  viajó hace varios años en busca de mejores días para  su familia, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Melida trabaja como chofer de transporte escolar, tiene una furgoneta en la que transporta diariamente a varios niños de las escuelas de la localidad, lleva un año en esta actividad, nos comenta que este es su segundo préstamo, con el dinero que reciba del crédito solicitado  a  la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR  va a realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo  y comprar llantas, su meta es seguir adelante y prosperar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Swan Communal Bank is located in the beautiful parish of El Valle in southwestern Cuenca. This area is famous for its agricultural production of corn, potatoes, and other crops. Tourist attractions such as the Cochapamba Lagoon are filled with reeds used for making mats, hats, and decorations. Tasqui Hill provides a beautiful view of the parish and the entire city of Cuenca. The people are very warm and friendly. They make you feel at home, which is why tourists enjoy being around them.

Melida L. is one of the active members of this Communal Bank. She has been a member for two years. Melida lives in the community of Chilca Totoras in El Valle Parish. She is 28 years old, married, and has an 11 year old daughter who attends the Dolores J. Torres School. Her husband has been living abroad for several years. He travels in search of better days for his family. His hard work has enabled them to build a house of their own.

Melida works as a school shuttle driver. She owns a van which she uses to transport numerous children every day to schools throughout the area. Melida has been in this business for one year. This is her second loan and will use the money from Fundación ESPOIR to maintenance her vehicle and purchase new tires. Her goal is to move forward and prosper in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance & purchase tires

loans.name: Flor De Valle Alto Group

texts.es:
Flor de Valle Alto, un grupo de 11 integrantes fraternales y alegres, se reunen en el Centro Focal Villa Adela cada dos semanas, liderizadas por su mesa directiva, así Aurora A. es la Presidenta, Trini Mabel Suñagua es la Tesorera y Luz Angela G. es la Secretaria de Actas, todas elaboran su reglamento interno para trabajar durante este primer ciclo.
La mayoría de las integrantes tienen el negocio de  venta de comida y ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar víveres, otras se dedican a tejer mantas y  necesitan comprar lana, por último algunas venden ropa, fruta y jugos y  requieren del préstamo para comprar mercadería.
Todas estan motivadas a hacer crecer sus negocios, sobre rodo por esta época de fin de año, donde el movimiento económico crece.
texts.en:
The Flor de Valle Alto (Flower of High Valley) is a group of 11 cheerful and fraternal members that meet at the Villa Adela communal bank every two weeks. Led by their governing body presided over by Aurora Aruqipa, Trini Mabel Suñagua, Treasurer, and Luz Angela G., Recording Secretary, they develop their by-laws under which they will work during this first cycle. Most of the members of this group sell prepared meals and they need the funding to buy groceries. Others are blanket weavers and need to buy wool. Lastly, some sell clothing, fruit, and juices and need funding to buy merchandise. All are motivated to see their businesses grow, above all during this end-of-year season, when economic activity is greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Patricia Marlene

texts.es:
Patricia Díaz  es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, este banco se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca, ésta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por su bella arquitectura, sus  hermosos templos,  los cuatro ríos que bañan ésta urbe  y las hábiles  manos de sus artesanos, además por su gente cálida y amable.

Patricia  vive en la comunidad de   Totoracocha, tiene 40 años de edad  de estado civil casada y madres de tres hijos  de 22, 20, 18 años, su dos primeros hijos estudian en el Instituto Sudamericano y su ultima hija estudia en el Instituto Ricardo Márquez Tapia, su esposo es de  profesión mecánico  juntos velan por el bienestar de su hogar, aún  no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.  

Nuestra socia se dedica a la preparación de comida que la vende en viandas  porque entrega a domicilio, además es propietaria de  una tienda de víveres que tiene  en casa de su madre en la comunidad de Limón en el oriente ecuatoriano a donde viaja los fines de semana  para ver como esta su negocio y dejarla surtiendo con nueva mercadería, lleva siete años realizando esta actividad.

Patricia nos comenta que hace cinco años fue socia de éste banco pero se retiró por problemas personales ahora está de regreso y muy contenta porque pronto recibirá el crédito solicitado con el que va a comprar una cocina y ollas que necesita para montar su restaurant.
texts.en:
. Patricia Díaz, 40, is a member of the María Reina de la Paz (Mary, Queen of Peace) communal bank which came together in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the capital of the Azuay province and is renowned for its beautiful architecture, its beautiful temples, the four rivers that bathe the city, and the able hands of its craftspeople as well as for its warm and kindhearted inhabitants. Patricia lives in the Totoracocha community, is married and has three children, 22, 20, and 18 years of age. Her first two are students at the Instituto Sudamericano and her youngest daughter studies at the Ricardo Márquez Tapia Institute. Her husband is a mechanic and together they watch after the wellbeing of their home. She still does not have a home of her own; she lives with her in-laws. Patricia prepares meals that she home delivers. Besides, she owns a small grocery store in her mother's house in the community of Limón, which is in the eastern part of Ecuador. She travels there on weekends to see how the store is doing and to stock it with merchandise. She has done this for 7 years. She tells us that five years ago she was a member of the bank but had to leave for personal reasons. However, now she is back and very happy because soon she will receive the requested loan with which she will buy kitchen equipment and pots that she needs to set up her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen equipment and pots for the restaurant.

loans.name: Flor Felicia

texts.es:
La señora  Flor Felicia  T. es una socia nueva del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, este banco se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca, ésta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por su bella arquitectura, sus  hermosos templos,  los cuatro ríos que bañan ésta urbe  y las hábiles  manos de sus artesanos, además por su gente cálida y amable como nuestras socias. 

Flor vive en el sector Monay, tiene 43 años de edad  se encuentra casada y ha procreado 3 hijos de 20, 13, 6 años, su primera hija estudia  en el Instituto Ricardo Márquez Tapia para ser profesora, la otra  hija  en el colegio Garaicoa y su último hijo en la escuela Miguel Ángel Estrella, su esposo trabaja en la fábrica de electrodomésticos Indurama y con los ahorros de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Flor trabaja en su tienda de víveres desde hace tres meses, su horario de atención  es de 7 a.m. a 8 p.m. Nos indica que éste es  su primer préstamo con la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR y el dinero obtenido  va a comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc. y artículos de limpieza para el hogar para  surtir su tienda y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su sueño es pagar todas sus deudas.
texts.en:
Flor Felicia T., 43, is a member of the new María Reina de la Paz (Mary, Queen of Peace) communal bank which was formed in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the capital of the Azuay province and is famous for its fine architecture, beautiful churches, the four rivers that bathe the city, the able hands of its craftspersons, and for its kind and warm-hearted inhabitants like our members. Flor lives in the Monay sector, is married and has three children, 20, 13, and 6 years old. Her eldest daughter is studying to be a teacher at the Ricardo Márquez Institute, her other daughter is a student at the Garaicoa school and her youngest son is in the Miguel Ángel Estrella school. Her husband works at the Indurama home appliance factory and they have managed, thanks to savings from his salary, to build their own house. For the last three months, Flor has worked in her grocery store. Her hours of operation are from 7am to 8pm. She tell us that this is her first loan with FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR and she will use the funds to buy basic need items like rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. and home cleaning items to stock her store and give better service to her customers. Her dream is to pay off all her debts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta, oil and home cleaning articles.

loans.name: Diéba

texts.fr: Diéba D. est une femme de 45 ans elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle développe un commerce de tissu à partir duquel elle se procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent d'équiper sa maison et de participer à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Diéba D. is a 45-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She is developing a fabrics business from which she derives profits that enable her to furnish her house and to help educate her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Alternativa Group

texts.es:
Alternativa  un grupo de 9 mujeres y 1 varón  se reúnen cada dos semanas  en el Centro Focal Los Andes, trabajan con la familia de Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 12 años. Cuentan con diferentes negocios que van desde el tejido de prendas de vestir,  elaboración de pan, producción de muebles, comercio de ropa, bolsas y venta de comida. Necesitan el préstamo para incrementar  su capital de trabajo, algunos comprando mercadería otras adquiriendo  material de trabajo.
Como son socias o clientas antiguas les gusta asitir al consultorio para hacerse un examen general, específicamente el Papanicolau, tambien  llevar a sus hijos para el control de peso y talla.
texts.en:
Alternativa is a group made up of 9 women and 1 man. They meet every two weeks at the Los Andes Communal Bank. They have been associated with the Pro Mujer family for the past 12 years.
