They have different lines of work which range from weaving clothing, to baking bread, to making furniture, clothing sales, bags, and sales of prepared meals. They need financing to increase their working capital, some to buy merchandise, others to get work supplies. Since they are long-standing clients, they like to come to the health center for general check-ups, specifically the Papanicolau test. They also bring their children in for weight and height monitoring.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work material and merchandise.

loans.name: Walter Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Walter Felix A. D. L. C. D. 47 años D. edad vive con su esposa L. Sra. D. L. C. Gabriel Rosa Iris D. 45 años D. edad. Tienen tres hijos los cuales asisten al colegio D. L. zona.
Viven en L. casa del padre D. Walter que queda en Pariña GranD.  - Pueblo Nuevo – Ica. 
Dicha vivienda fue afectada por el terremoto y con sus ahorros lograron levantar un pequeño módulo D. concreto el cual no cuenta con techo por ello  no pueden habitar en ese ambiente y continúan en carpas D. teL. y plástico que le donaron en el tiempo del desastre natural.
El Sr. es operario D. construcción desD. hace mas D. 15 años, su esposa se dedica a L. venta D. dulces y presta servicios D. limpieza. Ambos son bien trabajadores.
Solicitan el financiamiento para techar dicho ambiente y así lo puedan habitar sus hijos.
Los vecinos manifiestan que son unas personas responsables, trabajadores y emprendedores.
texts.en:
Walter Felix A. D. L. C., 47, lives with his wife, Rosa Iris Gabriel D. D. L. C., 45, and their three children, who all go to the local school. They live in Walter's father's house which is located in Pariña GranD. - Pueblo Nuevo – Ica. Said house was damaged by the earthquake and, using their savings, they were able to put up a small, concrete modular unit that does not have a roof, however. For this reason, they are unable to inhabit it yet and still must live under tarpaulin and plastic covers that were donated at the time of the natural disaster. Walter has been a construction worker for over 15 years and his wife sells candies and works as a cleaning lady. Both are very hard workers. They are asking for financing to install a roof on the unit so that their children can live in it. Their neighbors state that they are responsible, hard-working, enterprising people.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase corn and beans

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
La señora María Silvia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Alondras II”, Distrito de Bagua, Provincia de Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

María Silvia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, razón por la cual decidió implementar su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en un ambiente, muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 400.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus bebidas gasificadas, donde con el tiempo, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son los mismos trabajadores y personas que van a ser algún tramite en la Municipalidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
María Silvia, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
María Silvia, 33, is a member of the "Las Alondras II" (The Larks) communal bank which is in the Bagua district, Utcubamba province, Amazonas department. She lives with her life partner and their two sons, both of whom still are dependent on her. María Silvia is a hard-working, tenacious woman who decided to set up her own business selling carbonated beverages in a well-equipped environment. She herself administers her business, without a boss or a set schedule. She tells us that she started out with 400 soles and bought three cases of soft-drinks. She noted that she did very well but didn't have enough stock. In time, bit by bit, she invested more. Currently, she continues with the same business and she is well-known by her customers who are the same workers and persons who come to take care of paperwork at city hall. With this 1,000 sol loan she will buy more soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes and brands as well as mineral water, both sparkling and still. María Silvia has many goals before her and she feels motivated to see them come to fruition. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with her repayments and she intends to stay that way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packages of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es: Graciela C. de 36 años, casada y  madre de 3 niños, vende frutas desde muy joven, incluso antes de casarse, aprendió esta actividad de su madre, ella trae su mercadería de Alto Beni y los Yungas de la ciudad  de La Paz,  y vende en la zona El Tejar por mayor y por menor, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, específicamente naranja y postre. Trabaja con la familia de Pro Mujer desde hace 6 años, ha descansado un ciclo y ahora está retornando como nueva en un nuevo grupo que se llama Bolivia, que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Los Andes,  a ella le gusta mucho la capacitación porque tiene la oportunidad de seguir aprendiendo, también asiste al consultorio a hacerse el examen del PAP (papanicolau). Al igual que Graciela las demás integrantes tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de DVD, mantas, frutas  y atención de fotocopiadora. Necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Graciela C., 36, is married and the mother of three children. From a very young age, even before she was married, she has been a fruit seller. She learned this trade from her mother. She brings her merchandise from Alto Beni and Yungas to the city of La Paz and sells, at both wholesale and retail, in the El Tejar neighborhood. She needs financing to buy merchandise, especially oranges and postre (exotic fruit from the Bolivian Yungas). She has worked with the Pro Mujer family for six years. She took a cycle off but has now returned as a new member of a new group called Bolivia which, in turn, is part of the Los Andes communal bank. She likes the training very much because it is an opportunity to learn new things. She also comes to the health clinic for her PAP (Papanicolau) smear. Like Graciela, the other group members have their own lines of work such as: DVD rentals, blankets, fruit, photocopying services. They need funding to increase their working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Gotitas del Roció II”, Distrito de Bagua, Provincia de Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es Casada, tiene 25 años y próximamente mamá de 01 bebe.

Lleva 01 año, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Rosa Patricia, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, siendo muy joven le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Rosa Patricia belongs to the community bank “Gotitas del Roció II,” located in the Bagua District, Utcubamba Province, in the Amazonas Department. She is married, is 25 years old, and will soon be a mom. She has operated a rickshaw service for a year now. Her husband does the driving around town and she has saved to buy replacement parts and provide better service to the community. With the loan of PEN 1,000 she will buy parts, such as spark plugs and a steering column, will replace the oil, and buy lubricants, so that she can provide better service to her customers. Today, Rosa is an independent woman, and she and her husband make all the business decisions and manage the business operations. Rosa Patricia tells us that belonging to a group of women being so young, has helped her to learn about her rights, and that as a bloc, the women ensure those rights are respected. She thanks Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her in her beginnings as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying auto parts

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos, de 13 años, en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, sus cultivos principales son el trigo, la papa, la cebada, la arveja y el maíz; pero también cría ganado vacuno, principalmente toros para venderlos en las ferias ganaderas. 
Una vez que es la época de la cosecha vienen a buscarla comerciantes mayoristas que compran por camiones sus productos. Carmen prefiere esta modalidad porque no gasta en transporte, aunque admita que así las ganancias son menores, a vender directamente en el mercado.
Pero de esta forma, ella y su esposo siguen trabajando porque han logrado clientes seguros, el sostenimiento de su familia y el pago de la educación de sus hijos.

Esta es la novena vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona conciente de realizar un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal, por eso es muy apreciada por los demás integrantes de su grupo. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará sacos de abono para sembrar avena, cebada y trigo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 48, lives with her husband and their youngest son, 13, in her own house. For the past 20 years she has been a farmer and cattle rancher. Her main crops are wheat, potato, barley, peas and corn but she also raises cattle, especially bulls for sale at the livestock fairs. When harvest time arrrives, wholesale merchants come looking for her and they buy her products by the truckload. Carmen prefers this because she doesn't have to spend on transportation costs, although she admits that ther profits are lower this way, than selling directly in the market. However, this way has allowed her and her husband to continue working because they have secured regular customers that they can count on, they can support their family and afford to pay for the education of their children. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is a person who is well aware of the need to work cooperatively in her communal bank so she is well-liked by her fellow members. With these funds she will buy sacks of natural fertilizer to plant oats, barley and wheat.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 10 años, en su casa propia.
Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando principalmente la papa, la cual lleva a vender a la zona urbana de su localidad, y con los ahorros que logró conseguir adquirió dos carros para dedicarse al transporte. Por ello, desde hace un año su esposo maneja uno de ellos realizando transporte de pasajeros, y para el otro han contratado a un chofer; ambos cubren una ruta interprovincial.
De esta manera obtienen ingresos extras a la agricultura, lo necesario para sostener a su familia. En el transporte, se trabaja todos los días y no existe un día especifico de descanso, salvo se necesite hacer un mantenimiento mecánico de los carros. Este trabajo le ha permitido solventar los gastos familiares y ahorrar, por lo que está decidida en adquirir otro carro más.

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que es una buena experiencia, además del sistema de ahorros que tienen. Esta vez, el dinero que solicita será destinado a la compra de sacos de abono y semilla de papa para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Edith, 34, lives with her husband and two sons, 14 and 10 years old, in her own house. All of her life she's been a farmer, principally growing potatoes, which she takes to the urban areas of her location to sell. With her savings she was able to acquire two vehicles that are used for passenger transport. For the last year her husband has driven one of them and they hired a driver for the second vehicle; both cover an interprovincial route. This earns for them income in addition to what they get from farming which is enough to meet household needs. In transport, one works every day and there is no specific day off, unless one of the vehicles might need some type of maintenance. This work has allowed them to meet household expenses and even have some savings. For this reason, she wants to acquire yet another vehicle. This is her ninth loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of a communal bank because it is a good experience on top of the savings system they have. This time the requested funds will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer and potato seed for her next planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Willy Carlos

texts.es:
Willy tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y cinco hermanos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años trabaja como pintor de vehículos, el nos comenta que un amigo fue el que le enseñó esta actividad y desde entonces trabaja eventualmente pintando buses y autos. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en el apoyo a la economía de su familia.

Hace dos años, juntando el dinero de sus ahorros, adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que se gana el sustento durante las temporadas en que no trabaja como pintor. El aún no termina de pagar este vehículo, por lo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para terminar de pagarla y darle el mantenimiento que requiere debido al tiempo de uso.

Su sueño es poder comprar otra mototaxi para seguir adelante y apoyar a su familia. El es un joven optimista, trabajador y constante. En la fotografía aparece luego de su jornada de trabajo como pintor.
texts.en:
. Willy, 22, is single and lives with is mother and five siblings in the city of Chiclayo. For the last five years he has worked painting cars. He tells us that a friend taught him this skill and, since then, he gets occasional jobs painting cars and buses. What he earns he uses for his personal expensses and to help with family expenses. Two years ago, using all his savings, he acquired a mototaxi (three-wheeled, motorized vehicle, used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he earns his keep when he isn't painting vehicles. He hasn't paid off this vehicle yet so he is requesting financing from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 new soles to pay it off and do some service maintenance that it needs due to its time in use. His dream is to be able to buy another mototaxi so that he can continue to help support his family. He is an optimistic, steady and hard-working young man. In the photo he appears at the end of one of his work days as a car painter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish paying off and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and planks

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años.
Desde hace 32 años se dedica a la agricultura, todos los días sale a observar y cuidar sus tierras de cultivo, siendo su esposa su principal apoyo. Los productos principales que produce son la papa, el trigo, la cebada y la quinua; pero también se dedica a la crianza de animales (ovejas).
Sus mayores ingresos económicas están dados por la siembra de los granos, por eso cada vez que le es posible incrementa sus cultivos.
Este trabajo suele ser muy agotador, tanto para él como para su familia, pero esto es compensado con las ganancias que les permiten cubrir sus gastos, además de que siempre tiene disponible alimentos para su propio consumo y eso es una ventaja grande para su familia.

Esta es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contento de ser parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y medicina para sus animales.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 55, lives with his wife and two children, 12 and 8 years of age. For the last 32 years he has been a farmer. Every day he goes out to inspect and care for his plantings. His wife is his main collaborator. His main crops are: potato, wheat, barley, and quinoa (a main food staple of the Inca civilization, who held the crop to be sacred, quinoa has been cultivated for more than 5,000 years). However, he also raises farm animals (sheep). His main income is generated by his grains so every chance he gets he increases the size of his crops. This can be exhausting work, both for him and his family, but it is compensated for by the profits that allow him to cover costs. Besides, he always has food for his own consumption and this is a very big advantage for his family. This is his fourth loan with MFP and he is very happy to be part of a communal bank. The funding requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer and medicine for his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 40 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace más de 6 años se dedica a múltiples actividades que le permiten obtener los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes en el cuidado de los animales que cría, y los fines de semana vende comida.
Liz disfruta mucho de su trabajo, además que cuando cocina cuenta con la colaboración de sus hijos. 
Su deseo a futuro es reforzar su actividad ganadera, por lo que quiere ahorrar adquirir más animales con su capital propio, así su ganancia será más favorable. 

Este es su crédito número trece con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, que a lo largo de los años (cerca de 7) han sabido superar diversos problemas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más animales (cerdos) y empezará a sembrar alfalfa para alimentarlos.
texts.en:
Liz, 40, lives with her childen in her own house. For over 6 years she has been involved in a multitude of activities designed to earn funds to meet household needs. From Monday through Friday she works caring for the animals she raises; on weekends she sells prepared meals. Liz enjoys her work very much. Besides, when she cooks, she can count on her children's collaboration. Her wish for the future is to strengthen her cattle raising activity for which she wants to save money so that she can buy the animals with her own funds; that way her profits will be more favorable. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank which, for all these years (nearly 7) has known how to overcome various problems. With the funding requested now she will buy more animals (pigs) and start to plant alfalfa with which to feed them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura; siembra papa, trigo y cebada, esta activada la realiza en compañía de su esposo, pues ambos comparten estas arduas tareas, tanto en la época de siembra, como el la cosecha.
Una vez cosechados sus productos los venden directamente a los comerciantes del mercado central de su ciudad y es así como tienen mayores ganancias, sin intermediarios, que por lo general éstos pagan un precio que no compensa el grande esfuerzo.
Maruja y su esposo desean seguir adelante en estas tareas, por lo que aumentarán su  producción, viendo las posibilidades de adquirir terrenos propios y arrendar otros que les servirá para aumentar su producción.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo (aproximadamente 4 años) ha notado los beneficios del trabajo en equipo, por lo que está muy animada a continuar junto a su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y el pago de un tractor para remover la tierra.
texts.en:
Maruja, 33, lives with her husband and two children, 14 and 11 years of age, in her own house. She has been a farmer for the last 13 years. She cultivates potatoes, wheat and barley with her husband, who shares these arduous tasks with her both in planting time and during the harvesting. Once harvested, the products are sold directly to merchants in the city's central market. This way, their profits are higher; no middlemen, because, generally, middlemen pay prices that don't even make up for all the hard work. Maruja and her husband want to continue with this work, increasing their production, and looking into the possibility of both acquiring their own lands and leasing others to increase production. This is their 8th loan with MFP and in all this time (about 4 years) she has noticed the benefits to be had from working as a team for which she is very encouraged to stay with her group. The funds requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer and to pay to hire a tractor to till the land.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing haberdashery products

loans.name: Jesus Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Jesús Ysabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Gotitas del Roció II”, Distrito de Bagua, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Jesús Ysabel, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs Jesús Ysabel belongs to the communal bank "Little Dew Drops II" in the district of Bagua, Utcumbamba province in the Department of Amazonas. She is married, is 47 years old, and is the mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her.

Her strength and longing to provide for her kids motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. Her business is located in her own home and in an environment that is very pleasant for attending to her customers. The profits that she earns each day help her with her household income. From the beginning right up to the current date, she has been gaining customers and she currently has permanent customers who come to her house every day to shop and she attends to them personally with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of $350 she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, noodles in packets, milk and various brands of tinned fish in boxes, chickens in crates, and personal hygiene items. This will let her continue to give the best attention to her customers.

Jesús Ysabel, feels she has much strength to keep working and she is prepared to face life's adversities. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in the communities in which they work.


Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastes

loans.name: Roselfina

texts.es:
Roselfina tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años trabaja en las tareas del campo, ella es una emergente agricultora y ganadera, pues tiene vacas y una granja de cuyes en las cuales todas las mañanas, sin excepción, está al cuidado de su alimentación para que en el día que los comercialice obtenga una considerable ganancia.
Adicionalmente, Roselfina puede extraer entre 10 y 12 litros de leche diario, la cual también vende, y cuida de sus cultivos de alfalfa, ya que es lo indispensable para la alimentación de sus animales.

Es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante los años de permanencia en su banco comunal ha aprendido del trabajo en equipo y así ha ido progresando. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de semillas de alfalfa, alimento de sus cuyes y vacas.
texts.en:
Roselfina is 29 years old and lives with her husband and her 3 children in her own home. Rosalina has worked in the field for five years as an emerging livestock farmer. She has cows and a farm of guinea pigs which she feeds every morning without exception so that when it comes time to sell them they will be well nourished and she will gain a considerable profit. Additionally, Roselfina can extract between 10 and 12 litres of milk daily which she also sells, and she cares for her alfalfa crops, which are indispensable for the nutrition of her animals. This is the seventh time that Roselfina has applied for a loan through Kiva field partner MFP. During the years that she has been with this communal bank she has learnt to work in a team and through this has made progression. The loan that she is currently applying for will be used to buy alfalfa seeds to feed her cows and guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa seeds

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años compra y vende animales, los engorda en un periodo de aproximadamente 4 meses y los vende a un mayor precio. Ella es una excelente vendedora, su facilidad de palabra y capacidad de convencer logra que pueda transar un buen acuerdo de venta de ganado, y de esta manera conseguir el sustento para su familia.
Con el pasar del tiempo el capital de trabajo (animales) de Sulma se ha ido incrementando y eso la mantiene tranquila y satisfecha, aunque es agotador, pues debe estar pendiente en detalle de la alimentación e higiene de sus animales. 
Para el futuro, Sulma quiere tener mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para que continúe con esta actividad. 

Esta es la oportunidad número 11 en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y es muy apreciada por los demás integrantes de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más vacas.
texts.en:
Sulma is 51 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in her own house. She has bought and sold animals for the last five years, fattening them up over a period of approximately four months and then selling them at a profit. She is an excellent saleswoman, as her way with words and her capacity for persuasion lead to reaching a beneficial agreement when it comes time to sell her cattle, and in this way she is able to create income for her family. With the passing of time Sulma's working capital (animals) has increased and this has kept her satisfied and at peace, although it is tiring work, since she has to always keep a watchful eye on the diet and hygiene of her animals. In the future, Sulma would like to have a larger amount of cattle to continue in this line of work. This is the eleventh loan opportunity that MFP have offered her. She is part of this communal bank and is highly valued by the other members of her group. The loan that she is applying for will be used to buy more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, todos en edad escolar, en el caserío Salitral, distrito D. Motupe, ubicado a una hora y quince minutos D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Hace dos años aprendió el oficio D. estilista en un instituto D. L. ciudad D. Motupe y con recursos propios instaló una peluquería en su domicilio, allí atienD. a sus clientes durante todo el día y los ingresos que percibe le sirven para apoyar L. economía diaria D. su familia.

Debido a L. calidad del servicio que brinda su negocio ha ido creciendo, Agustina piensa en ampliarlo pero no cuenta con el capital que necesita para lograr su objetivo, por lo que se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en mobiliario para su establecimiento.

Su más granD. sueño es poder implementarm su establecimiento y convertirlo en un salón D. belleza completo. ElL. es una mujer creativa y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Agustina is 34 years old, married and lives with her husband and her four children, all school-aged. They live in the hamlet of Salitral, a district of Motupe, located one hour and 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago she learnt the stylist traD. at an institute in the city of Motupe and with her own resources she set up a hairdresser's in her home, where she attends her clients all day. This income supports the daily needs of her family. Due to the quality of service that she brings to her business, it has been growing to the point where Agustina is thinking of expanding it, but she does not have the capital to achieve her goal. This is why she has seen it necessary to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 800 nuevos soles which she intends to invest in furnishings for her business. Agustina's greatest dream is to be able to convert her residence into a complete beauty salon. She is a very creative and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furnishings to expand her hairdresser's

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús II”, Distrito de Bagua, Provincia de Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es Soltera, tiene 55 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su propio negocio de Venta de Comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en su misma casa. En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Adela, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mercedes participates in the Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazon de Jesus II” in the Bagua District of the Province of Utcubamba , Dept. of the Amazonas. She is single and a 55-year old mother of one son who depends on her. With the security of having better cooking conditions, she is able to prepare different types of cuisines. Of her own doing, with the first loan of S/. 300.00, she undertook a business of selling meals she would typically make in her own home. In actuality, despite it being time consuming she continues this same business for her loyal clients who come to her daily. She attends to her clients in charismatic fashion. With a loan of S/. 800.00 she will buy ingredients used for daily food preparations, such as a sack of rice, sugar, cooking packages, chicken halves and also some utensils for cooking work. She wants to give her clients her best efforts. She prepares everything and still feels strong enough to run the business and continues forward. She is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their contributions towards her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchases ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Dye Humberto

texts.es:
Dye tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a su madre y un hermano en el caserío La Arena, distrito de Motupe, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Motupe.

Hace dos años, con la ayuda de su madre, pudo comprarse una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado para el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que actualmente presta servicios de transporte entre la ciudad de Motupe y sus caseríos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad es el único sustento económico de su hogar ya que su padre los abandonó hace dos años.

Los caminos de la zona son muy accidentados y debido al constante uso su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir fallas mecánicas que dificultan el buen funcionamiento de su unidad móvil. Por este motivo Dye se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El gran anhelo de Dye es comprar otra mototaxi con la que pueda seguir brindándole el sustento a su familia. El es un joven responsable, empeñoso y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Dye, 18, is single and lives with his mother and brother in the La Arena settlement, Motupe district which is located two hours away from the city of Motupe. Two years ago, with help from his mother, he was able to buy himself a mototaxi (a three-wheeled, motorized, vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he currently offers transportation services between the city of Motupe and surrounding settlements. The earnings he gets from this activity is the only source of income for the family since their father abandoned them two years ago. The roads in the area are very rough and, due to the constant use it has been subjected to, his vehicle has started to have mechanical problems that adversely affect its proper functioning. This has forced Dye to have to call upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for help in the form of a 1000 new sol loan. Dye's great wish for the future is to buy another mototaxi so that he will be able to continue supporting his family. He is a responsible, enterprising and very hardworking young man.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su último hijo de siete años en el caserío Las Pampas, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y cincuenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 8 años se dedica al comercio de ganado ovino: cría ovejas en su casa y luego las vende a los compradores que frecuentan la zona. Esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso económico familiar por lo que Víctor da lo mejor de sí para mantener a sus animales.

Todos los días Víctor realiza el pastoreo de sus ovejas desde muy temprano, pero el pasto de la zona no brinda los nutrientes necesarios para una buena alimentación por lo que ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a su hijo una profesión con la cual asegure su futuro. Víctor es un padre responsable, es muy entregado a su familia y a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Victor is a 53-year-old head of household. He lives with his wife and the youngest of his children, his 7-year-old son, in the Las Pampas settlement, Olmos district, which is an hour and fifty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 8 years he has raised sheep at home which he then sells to buyers who come by the area. This is his only source of income so Victor gives the best of himself to care for his animals. Every day Victor takes his sheep to pasture from very early in the morning. However, the grasses in the area do not provide the required nutrients for his sheep to be well-nourished. This is why he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, to ask for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his sheep. His greatest wish is to be able to provide his son with the means to study a profession that will assure his future. Victor is a responsible father, very devoted to his family and to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seed, groceries, for family expenses, food and schooling.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Sobresalientes II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 45 años y 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de arroz y azúcar al por menor, ya que de esta manera aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, lleva 05 años en el negocio y desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y haciéndose conocida. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa  a comprar, o es ella misma quien juntamente con su esposo, se trasladan por diferentes calles, a repartir y ofrecer sus productos y es ella quien personalmente les atiende con la amabilidad y el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en kilos; parte del dinero también lo invertirá en repuestos y combustible, para su motokar, herramienta principal, para repartir sus productos.

Mirtha, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirtha is a member of the Banco Comunal “Mujeres Sobresalientes II” in the Morales District in the Province of San Martin – Dept. of San Martin. She is married and is 45-years old with two children. They depend on her and are currently studying. Her character and her desire to carry out her dreams, motivates her to undertake a business of selling rice and sugar at retail. It is because of this work ethic that she has seen great profits. She has been at this business for 5 years and right from the start she has gained a lot of clients and has become very well known. She has daily clients who come by her house to make purchases and works with her husband on the same business. They transport products along different streets, offering their goods to clients with attentiveness, kindness and charisma. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00 she will buy rice and sugar by the kilo and with a portion of the loan they will also invest in spare parts, gas tanks, tools to distribute her goods. Mirtha has a great desire to continue working and is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women develop in the environment where they conduct business.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar by the kilo.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus cinco hermanos en el sector Indoamérica, en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace siete años trabaja como mototaxista, hace cuatro años compró una mototaxi con la cual se viene ganando la vida todos los días desde muy temprano hasta la tarde. Generalmente brinda sus servicios dentro de la misma ciudad y caseríos aledaños. Este negocio es la única fuente de sustento con la que cuenta y las ganancias que percibe las utiliza en sus gastos personales y el apoyo económico de su hogar.

Debido a que su vehículo es la única fuente de ingreso el trata de cuidarlo mucho, cada nueve meses le brinda un mantenimiento general, pero en esta ocasión, debido al tiempo de uso, su unidad móvil ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi.

Carlos es un joven empeñoso, amable y muy responsable. Su sueño es poder instalar un puesto de venta de ropa para tener una fuente de ingresos más estable con la cual seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 28, is single and lives with his five siblings in the Indoamérica section of Lambayeque which is 20 minutes form the city of Chiclayo. He has been a mototaxi driver for the last 7 years. Four years ago he bought his own mototaxi with which he earns his living daily from very early until very late. Generally, he offers his services within the same city or neighboring settlements. This is his only source of income and the profits he earns he uses for personal expenses and to help with household expenses. Because his vehicle is his only source of income, he works very hard to take care of it. Every nine months it gets general servicing. However, on this occasion, due to the heavy usage it's had, his unit has begun to suffer mechanical difficulties so he has had to call upon Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to repair and service his mototaxi. Carlos is a very responsible, nice, go-getting young man. His dream is to be able to set up a stand to sell clothing so that he can have a more stable source of income with which to continue to help support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service and repair mototaxi.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta De Racsa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”. El banco comunal esta conformado por 11 socios y es nuevo. Los socios radican en la provincia del Cusco. La mayoría de ellos tienen un stand independiente en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” pero con actividades de trabajo similares. El mercado “Virgen Asunta” tiene 3 años de fundación. La reunión de las socias se hace en el stand de la socia Angelica.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de papas, bolsas, granos. La socia Marianela se dedica a la venta de granos como maíz, fréjoles, habas, cebada, trigo, etc.  Las socia Antonia se dedica a venta de bolsas para empaquetar papas. La gran parte de la socias y socios se dedican a la venta de papas al por mayor, ellos distribuyen papas a todos los demás mercados de la cuidad.   

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(El socio José no asistió a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y no aparece en la fotografía, pero pidió permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal).
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA” communal bank. The bank is made up of 11 members and it is new. The members are residents of Cusco province. Most of them have independent stalls in the "Virgen Asunta" market but with similar lines of work. The "Virgen Asunta" market is three years old. The group meetings are held in Angelica's stand. Our members alternate their various domestic chores with sales of potatoes, sacks, and grains. Marianela, for example, sells grains like corn, kidney beans, barley, wheat, etc. Antonia sells potato sacks. Most of the members sell wholesale potatoes; they distribute their potatoes to the other municipal markets. The members are asking for financing to use as working capital so that they can increase their products and sales thereby providing their families with improved quality of life. The members value and appreciate the loan granted and pledge to repay in a timely fashion. (The member José did not attend the meeting due to work obligations so does not appear in the photo. He did, however, ask the governing board of the communal bank for permission to be absent).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase purchase and sale of potatoes.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su abuela y sus primos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Sus padres se separaron hace 10 años, actualmente su madre radica en Argentina y su padre vive en la ciudad de Huaraz.

Jorge había empezado a estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo, pero por motivos económicos tuvo que dejarla hace año y medio y con el apoyo de su abuela pudo comprar una mototaxi de segunda mano con la que se está ganando la vida. Trabaja desde muy temprano hasta muy avanzada la tarde. Esta actividad es la única que le genera ingresos, los cuales utiliza en sus gastos personales y apoyando al sostenimiento de su familia.

Debido al uso otorgado y a la antigüedad del vehículo éste ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas y Jorge no tiene el dinero suficiente para repararlas. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Jorge desea terminar su carrera e instalar un taller de reparación de motos con el cual pueda seguir saliendo adelante y apoyando a los suyos. El es un joven empeñoso, responsable y muy inteligente.
texts.en:
Jorge, 23, is single and lives with his grandmother and cousins in the city of Lambayeque, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. His parents separated 10 years ago; his mother lives in Argentina and his father lives in the city of Huaraz. Jorge had started to study business administration in an institute in Chiclayo but, due to lack of funds, had to abandon his studies a year and a half ago. With is grandmother's help he was able to buy a second-hand mototaxi with which he is earning his livelihood. He works from very early in the morning until well into evening. This is his only source of income which he uses to defray personal expenses and to help support the family. Because of the heavy usage and the age of the vehicle, it has begun to have mechanical difficulties but Jorge lacks the funds to make repairs. For this reason, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1000 new sol loan, which he will use to service and repair his vehicle. Jorge wants to finish his studies and set up a vehicle repair shop so that he can continue to get ahead in life and support his loved ones. He is a very intelligent, responsible and astute young man.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y la última de sus cinco hijos en el sector Las Dunas, distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como albañil y lo que percibe no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares, tiene desde hace dos años una bodega en su casa con la cual viene apoyando la economía familiar. Ella nos cuenta que anteriormente tuvo también una pequeña bodega pero que cayó enferma y tuvo que cerrarla. Ahora su negocio está creciendo nuevamente y ha empezado a ofrecer verduras, frutas, artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.

Teodolinda está pensando en ampliar su negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad se solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el logro de su objetivo.

Ella tiene pensado seguir ampliando su negocio y renovar su casa con las ganancias que percibe. Teodolinda es una mujer luchadora y que siempre trata de salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades.
texts.en:
Teodolinda, 40, lives with her husband and the last of their five children in the Las Dunas sector in the Lambayeque district. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Due to the fact that her husband works occasionally as a bricklayer, and what he receives is not sufficient to cover the family expenses, she decided two years ago to open a convenience store in her house. The store supports her family economically. She tells us that she previously had a small convenience store, but she fell ill and had to close it. Now her business is growing again, and she has started to sell vegetables, fruits, basic needs items, and groceries. Teodolina is planning on expanding her business, but she does not have sufficient capital to do so. That is why she has seen the need to ask Edpyme Atlernativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 PEN. She plans to invest it in order to reach her objective. She plans on continuing to expand her business and renovating her house with the earnings she receives. Teolinda is a fighter, and she always tries to get ahead in spite of difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products to expand her business

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.en: Committee Barrio Alegre was formed on July 16, 2008. The women’s committee began as an initiative by Zulli G. who brought together 16 women. They are currently on their fourth cycle. All team members are very happy with the partnership and work in solidarity and support each other. The average credit drawn by each member is 593,000 Gs. Most women use their loans to improve their businesses in selling clothes, food (dried fruits, rice, sugar, noodles, milk), books, baked goods, cleaning supplies, fabric and dress-making patterns. The group is very active and have achieved a lot working together.

loans.use: Purchased merchandise

loans.name: Evodio

texts.es:
El señor Evodio S. tiene ya más de siete años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes y elaboración de panes. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta cierta inversión pero  no cuenta con el dinero necesario y no quiere descapitalizar en negocio. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo  y así invertir le más su negocio y a la elaboración del pan, ya que muchos compañeros de el que también tiene negocio le están solicitando que les surta de pan. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias de la inversión, ya que este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y desea que sus tres hijos tengan una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Evodio Segua has been selling groceries and making bread for over seven years. He needs an inversion in his business, but he does not have the money to do so. He does not want to strip the assets from the business. That is why he is asking for a loan, to invest more in his business and making bread. Many of his colleagues also have a business, and they are asking him to supply them with bread. He plans to pay the loan with part of the earnings from the inversion. This business is the source of income for his family. He wants his three children to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inversion in his business

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el caserío Valle Nuevo, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica al comercio de animales, nos comenta que la mayoría de familias de la zona recurren a este negocio como una fuente estable de ingresos familiares debido a que la agricultura, la principal actividad económica de la zona, no les provee el sustento permanente que necesitan.

Paula cría aves de corral, ovejas y vacas que luego ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan las distintas zonas aledañas. La escasez de agua que hay por la zona ha hecho que la cantidad de pasto con que alimenta a sus animales disminuya, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas y ovejas.

Ella es una madre trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable al momento de asumir susu cuotas.
texts.en:
Paula, 42, lives with her husband and their five children in the Valle Nuevo village in the Mochumí district. It is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. Animals are her business. She tells us that the majority of families in the region turn to this business as a source of stable income for the family. This is due to the fact that farming, which is the principal economic activity in the region, does not provide the permanent support they need. Paula raises poultry, sheep, and cows. She later sells them to the businessmen who visit from the different outlying areas. The scarcity of water in the region has diminished the amount of grass that her animals eat. That is why she has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1000 PEN. She plans to use it to buy balanced food for her cows and sheep. She is a very hard-working mother, and she is devoted to her family. She has worked with us previously, demonstrating responsibility when it came time to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced food for her livestock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Lucia Z. le está haciendo falta terminar un cuarto, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que su esposo se encargar de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder terminar la recamara que será para sus tres hijos ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Doña Lucia tiene ya más de tres años de dedicándose a su negocio la venta de abarrotes 
con las ganancias del  negocio planea pagar el préstamo, ya que su esposo el señor José Concepción Ramírez se encargara de los gastos familiares, con su sueldo que obtiene como empleado de una fabrica en el departamento de producción.
texts.en:
A room in Lucia Z.’s house needs to be finished. At this time she does not have the money that is needed to be able to buy the material. Her husband will be responsible for making the improvement by working extra hours. She is asking for the loan to be able to finish a bedroom, which her three children will use. Now that they are growing, they need their own space in the house. Lucia has been in the business of selling groceries for over three years. She plans to repay the loan with earnings from this business. Her husband, José Conceptión Ramírez, pays for the family expenses with the salary he gets as an employee in the production department of a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish a room

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.en:
The Victoria Women’s Committee was formed on the 7th of January 2009, thanks to Sra.Esperanza T., who contacted the counselor at a local weekly meeting to find out how the Women’s Entrepreneurship program worked. She gathered 17 hard working and humble women together, who are now on their 4th loan cycle. 

The average credit drawn by each member is 658,000 Gs., which is used for different activities such as selling fruits and vegetables, selling items for the pantry (rice, sugar, grass, dairy, bakery, meat, etc.), food, cosmetics, clothing sale, sale of library, selling lingerie, etc.. 
All committee members attend weekly meetings and work together to achieve all their common objectives.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eliazar Iván

texts.es:
Al negocio del señor Eliazar Iván G. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, le esta haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía que necesita su negocio para que tenga más ingresos. Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de las ventas, ya que los gastos familiares se cubrirán con el ingreso de su trabajo una maquiladora en el departamento de operación. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hermana la señorita María Reyna G. quien le ayuda a tender el negocio cuando el se encuentra trabajando.
texts.en:
Eleazar Iván G. has had his business of selling groceries for over six years. He needs a greater variety of merchandise. At this time he does not have the money necessary to invest in his business. He is asking for the loan to be able to buy the merchandise that his business needs in order to get more income. He plans to repay the loan with earnings from sales. He will cover the family expenses with the income from his work in the operations department of an assembly plant. The person appearing in the photo is his sister, María Reyna G., who helps him tend the business when he is working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. and her husband, Mr. Kheav Boran, have been married since 1983. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is married and lives outside the family home. One of her daughters has full time employment and the other lives at home. The youngest son is in school. Her family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. Her husband is shown in the photo. 

Mach has been selling jackfruit since 1999. She buys the fruit from the Neak Meas Market (fruit market) to sell at her shop in Phnom Penh. Besides this business, she also rents part of her house to garment factory workers. Her husband has been driving motor taxi for two years. 

Mach hopes to expand her business and make it bigger, so that she can generate more income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy additional jackfruit for resale.

loans.use: To buy more jackfruit to sell.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab T., 33, and her husband, Mr. Seng Ket, 33, have been married since 1999 and have three sons. Two of them are in school, and other one is still young and stays at home. The family lives along National Road 20, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Leab has been growing rice for nine years. She has also started another business to supplement the family’s income by using her motorbike to transport vegetables and fish to sell at market in Phnom Penh.

Leab’s motorbike is old and does not work well, so she is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase a replacement for the old one.

loans.use: To buy a replacement motorbike to take her fish and vegetables to market.

loans.name: Katherine Frida

texts.es: Katherine tiene 22 años, vive en casa de su padres y sus hermanos, Katherine termino la secundaria no pudo realizar estudios superiores por  carencias económicas.Katherine  hace 2 años volvió a iniciar el negocio que tenían sus padres antes del terremoto, en el desastre sus padres perdieron su casa y casi toda la mercadería que se encontraba en ese entonces, se dedicaban a la venta de golosinas y abarrotes en general. Katherine inicio el negocio con ahorros propios producto de su trabajo como obrera de planta en una Agro Exportadora, Katherine realiza las ventas de su mercadería en su vivienda, y a sus clientes les brinda un trato muy calido y agradable, ella atiende su negocio en las mañanas y su madre la ayuda en las tardes ya que ella labora, su clientela ha ido incrementándose, y la mayoría de sus clientes son de la misma zona donde ella vive, solicita el crédito para la compra de la mercadería que ofrecerá en la temporada navideña. Katherine desea poder estudiar Administración de Empresas en la Universidad, por ese motivo sus ahorros los invierte para poder tener mayores ingresos y así poder pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Katherine is 22 years old and lives at home with her parents and siblings. She completed her secondary school education but has been unable to attend any university courses for economic reasons. Two years ago she restarted the business her parents had before the earthquake. In the disaster, her parents lost their house and almost all the merchandise that they had. Since then, they have devoted themselves to the sale of candy and grocery items. Katherine began the new business with her own savings that she earned from working in the fields at an Agro Exportadora ("Exporter of Agriculture"). She sells her merchandise at home and offers her customers warm service and good prices. She serves her customers in the mornings and her mom helps her during the afternoons. Since she has been working, her clientele has been increasing and the majority of her customers are from her own neighborhood. Katherine is asking for a loan so she can buy merchandise to offer during the Christmas season. Ultimately, she would like to attend university and study Business Administration. For this reason, she is investing her savings to be able to bring in more income and be able to pay for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Tiyum

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiyum M., 54, is a widow with two children (she is shown in the above photo with her son). She lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Tiyum M. has been fishing since she was young, a skill she learned from her parents. She fishes from the Mekong River and sells her catch in her village. She is requesting a loan of $300 USD to purchase a boat and new fishing nets for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and new fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger R. is from the village of Liloan Bonifacio Misamis Occ.. He is 38 years old and is married. To make a living, Roger owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roger joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roger from GDMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family and save for future needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vanra

texts.en:
Miss Vanra C., 27, is single and lives with her parents and her sibling on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who in turn markets them in Phnom Penh.

Vanna is requesting her second loan of 500 USD to purchase silk so she can continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena D. has been a rolling store vendor for almost five years now. She uses her pedicab (bicycle with sidecar) to sell vegetables, snacks, meat and fish around her village and in nearby villages. She also sells other products that are needed in their village.

Elena is 43 years old and married to Mr. Ruben D.. Ruben is a junk dealer. He is 38 years old and has three children with his wife, Elena. They are from the village of Cabaritan, San Manuel, Isabela. They want to improve the business for the future of their family; thus, Elena has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders for additional business capital. She hopes that lenders will approve this loan.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila A.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Mantik, Tangub City. Leonila has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell and to buy feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family and for future needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and to buy feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mercedes Isabel

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 26 años,es madre soltera tiene una hija de 5 años. Mercedes vive en casa de su madre el  cual le ayuda en el cuidado de su hija. Mercedes inicio hace 1 año el negocio de venta de todo tipo de descartables plàsticos en el mercado de la ciudad de Ica, el negocio lo inicio con ahorros propios.El cual Mercedes brinda un buen trato a sus clientes que acuden a su puesto de ventas por tal motivo ha incrementado su clientela poco a poco. Mercedes desea implementar su negocio ya que en las fiestas navideñas se realizan pedidos de mayor cantidad y ella no posee el stop para cubrir el total de los pedidos, por tal motivo solicita el dinero para la compra de mayor mercaderia. Mercedes trabaja cada dia con el unico fin de brindarle a su pequeña lo necesario para que no sienta la ausencia del padre, y que asi su hija pueda disfrutar las comodidades que les dejara el negocio de su madre, brindandole una buena educacion lo cual le brindara el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 26 year old single mother with a 5 year old daughter. Mercedes lives with her mother who helps her take care of her daughter. Mercedes began her business one year ago and sells all kinds of disposable plastic containers in the city of Ica's market. She started this business with her personal savings. Mercedes offers good service and prices to the customers that come to her market stall. As a consequence, her clientele has slowly increased. She wishes to equip her business for the Christmas season so she can fulfill a greater number of customer orders, but she doesn't have the finances to cover the cost of all of the extra merchandise. For this reason, she is asking for a loan so she can buy more merchandise. Mercedes works every day with the primary goal of providing her young daughter with her basic living needs so that she doesn't feel the absence of her father and enjoy the comforts that her mother's business brings her like offering a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat C. (pictured with his mother) is 20 years old and single.  He lives with his parents and brothers and sisters along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Socheat has been growing lotus for 6 years. He wants to supplement his income by starting a duck-raising business. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to buy ducks to raise. He will also use part of the loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing lotus.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for growing lotus.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio I. owns and operates a specialized retail store and also has a business making furniture for sale in his community. He is 45 years old, married and has five grown-up children. He is from the village of Liloan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Elpedio has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Elpedio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Elpedio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family and to save in reserve for future needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Miss Sitha L., 34, is single and lives with her parents and sister on an island on the Mekong River approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her sister is employed full-time in Phnom Penh.

Miss Sitha has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk material to continue her silk-weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business.

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en:
Sherwin is married to Erlinda, who has been working as a domestic helper in Kuwait for almost seven years. Sherwin wants to improve their living conditions, so he works hard to help his wife earn a living for their family. He lives with their eight year old son, Lyndsher, who is now in grade III. He and his wife help one another to send their son to school and hope that he will continue his education until he graduates from college.

Farming is Sherwin's main source of income, but he also works as a tricycle (three-wheeled motorcycle-taxi) driver in their village for additional income. He now wants to borrow PHP 8,000 from the KIVA lenders to repair his tricycle. He is hoping that the lenders will grant his loan request because this will be very helpful to his business.

loans.use: To maintain his tricycle

loans.name: Ateykak

texts.en:
Mrs. Ateykak T., 43 and her husband, Mr. Try Sman, 45, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have 3 sons and 4 daughters. Two of their children are married and live with their parents. One son is a fisherman, three other children are attending school, and the youngest stays home.

Her husband catches fish, and Ateykak sells the fish in the village. Mr. Try Sman has been fishing since he was young. He fishes in the Mekong River and the lake near his village. He wants another boat motor; this will make it easier for him to operate the business. 

Hence Ateykak is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase another boat motor for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase another boat motor for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Revelita

texts.en:
Revelita is from the village of Santo Domingo in Luna, Isabela. She manages a hog-raising business that serves as her main source of income. She is 41 years old and lucky to be married to Joel C., who is 42 years of age. They are blessed with two children, Benigno and Belinda. Benigno is 20 years old and he stopped his schooling because of lack of finances. Belinda is 17 years old and is a second-year college student taking a hotel and restaurant management course. Revelita is thankful that the income from her business has been very helpful in paying her daughter's tuition and educational expenses. 

Revelita wants to borrow Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders to buy pig feed. She wants to help her husband to provide for their family’s daily needs. For an extra source of income, they have a thresher, which is a machine that separates the shells or skins of fruit from the fruit body, but their thresher operates only 
when corn and rice are being harvested.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. wants a loan from Kiva lenders. She sells retain goods in her general store, and also sells fish, meat and barbecue. She has been engaged in her business for three years. Zenaida is 34 years old and is married to Alfredo, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, Freddie and Beseree. Freddie has graduated with a degree in Business Accountancy. Beseree is currently in school.

Zenaida wishes to succeed in her business. She wanted to borrow Php 10,000 from KIVA lenders to use as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy wants to improve her family's living conditions and is doing her best to achieve it. Daisy is 30 years old and married, but she does not have a child.  Daisy has been managing a sari-sari (community-based variety store) in her village for four years. She also started a junk shop business. She is glad her businesses are doing well.  

Daisy’s husband source of income is farming. She wants to expand her small businesses, so she wants to borrow PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. This loan will help her to purchase basic commodities for her store and to maintain her junk shop business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store and junk shop business

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Mr. Musa K., 41 and his wife, Mrs. Maismes Sos, 39, live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. One of their sons is a construction worker; the other children are still young and attend school. 

Musa and his wife are fish sellers. They fish in the Mekong River and the lake near their village and sell the fish in the local market. Musa wants a boat motor; it will make it easier for him to move his boat from one place to another. Hence he is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase a boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.name: Polima

texts.en:
Polima V. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Polima harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Polima has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2007, Polima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Polima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD. She use her previous loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Polima is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST to expand her business. This will be Polima's third loan from SPBD. Polima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her family's living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Arrabella

texts.en:
Arrabella has a hog-raising business. She needs additional capital, so she wants to borrow PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan funds to buy another piglet, some pig food, and supplies for her pigs. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan so she can pursue her business plans. She prays that her business will become profitable for the sake of her family.

Arrabella is 33 years old and is married to Alejandro, who is a businessman. They do not have a child yet, but they will never lose hope that God will bless them some day.

loans.use: Additional piglet, feed, and supplies

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. raises fruits and vegetables on her small farm and then sells them. The fruits bring her more income than the vegetables. Estrella is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables and some supplies that she needs for her vegetable farm. She hopes that her loan will be approved so she can maintain and improve her business.

Estrella is 55 years old. She is married to Jose, who is a barangay (village) policeman in Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela, where their family lives. Estrella and her husband have four children. Two of them are in school, one in elementary and one in high school. Her two other children have already finish their studies. She hopes that her children will find a good future some day.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her fruit and vegetable farm

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie M. is 44 years old. She is married to Rosendo, who is a farmer. They live in the village of Cabaritan in San Manuel, Isabela.
