Rosalie has a manicure and pedicure business. To earn extra income, she also goes door-to-door selling vegetables and snacks in their village. Rosalie and her husband are blessed with three children, Rosanna, Richelle, and Ronald. They are all high school graduates.

Rosalie has been in business for five years. When she heard about the ASKI program, it gave her hope that her business would continue. Then she heard about Kiva and she decided request a loan from the lenders. She wants to borrow Php 6,000 to use as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Taufaiesea

texts.en:
Taufaiesea L. is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Taufaiesea sells dairy products in the local community. Taufaiesea has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 280 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Taufaiesea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Taufaiesea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. She used her previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Taufaiesea is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST to expand her business. This will be Taufaiesea's 3rd loan from SPBD. Taufaiesea plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Asa

texts.en:
Asa P. is a 33-year-old woman who lives in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Asa grows and sells fruits and vegetables. Asa has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 320 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Asa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. She used her previous loan to buy farm supplies and equipment. Asa is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST to buy farm supplies and equipment. This will be Asa's second loan from SPBD. Asa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve her family's living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Bangko, Panaon, Mis. Occ. She is 42 years old. Jocelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia owns a general store in their village. She has been managing it for years already and she hopes that it will further grow with the help of KIVA lenders. She hopes for a loan of PHP 5,000 to have additional capital to purchase more grocery items for her store. She plans to increase the number of items that she sells to attract more customers. In this way, her general store could become more profitable. 

Anatalia is a 48-year-old businesswoman. She has been married for 23 years to Mario who is a farmer. The couple is not yet blessed with kids and they don’t have anyone to support now except their selves. Their income from the business is being used for their daily expenses and some is saved for their future needs. The couple hopes to maintain their retail business in order to have a source of income to support their needs until they grow older.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her genreral store

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov C., age 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sophal Oeun, age 29, live along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1999 and have two children, who are in school. 

Pov has been a construction worker for 2 years. He works in his village. His wife has been selling fish for one year.  Their house is too small for their family. That is why Pov is applying for his first loan of $500 to renovate his house.

loans.use: To renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Rofel

texts.en:
Rofel is 30 years old and married to Crisanta, his partner in their furniture shop business.  He is a responsible father to their three children and they live in the village of Anquiray Amulung Cagayan.

Rofel raises and breeds hogs for a living. Aside from that, he and his wife decided to invest in a furniture shop business that they are now managing. Rofel is grateful that God gave him a talent in woodcarving, which is a big factor in pursuing their business.

With their desire to expand the business, Rofel and his wife have decided to request additional business capital of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders. Despite the hardship that they are experiencing, Rofel is determined and very patient in making his business become productive. He added that "With their faith and God's help, they will be able to fight the challenges in life and sustain the needs of their family."

loans.use: Additional capital for furniture business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima T. has been engaged in her hog raising business for 10 years. She is married to Marcos who is a farmer and operates his own tricycle. As a fruit of their love, the couple is blessed with two children: Manilyn who is in fourth year high school and Mildred Mae who is a grade II student. The family lives in the village of Cabaritan, San Manuel, Isabela. 

Geronima is still looking for another source of income but she decided to stick with her business and manage it well. She wants to continuously operate her business because it can also help her support their needs, especially the educational needs of their children. She wants to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP5,000 for maintenance of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to maintain her pig feed

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phallin Y., 26, and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Noun, 38, have been married since 1996. They have three sons and one daughter, three of whom are in school; the youngest stays at home. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phallin has been selling groceries from in front of her house for ten years. Her husband assists his wife in the business. Because their house is located near a garment factory, they also rent rooms in their house to garment factory workers.

In response to these workers’ needs, Phallin is requesting her first loan, 500 USD, to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy P. lives in Negros Occidental, a province of the western Visayas islands. Her village, Talusan, is part of Bulanon, a barangay of Sagay City. She is 31 years old and married to Jerry, a 37-year-old fisherman. They have four children; the oldest is eleven, and Juvy just gave birth to her youngest child a month ago. Their two older children are already attending school, and Juvy hopes that she and her husband will be able to afford to send all of their children through school and on to college so they will have better opportunities in their adult life. In pursuit of this dream, Juvy has helped her husband in his fishing venture. They wake up very early in the morning so that they can reach the market ahead of others and get a good price for their catch.

In 2001, she decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon to access additional capital for their fishing business. With the help of successive loans she has been able to purchase additional fishing gear, thus enabling them to catch more fish. With the help of one of her loans, she was able to purchase another fishing boat, adding to their income capacity. She now nets an average monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, which she is happy to note is quite enough for their young family for the time being. But she is determined to continue to strive hard to save up for the future.

She previously borrowed 19,500 PHP, which she used as working capital for her fishing business. She paid the loan's weekly installments without delay throughout the loan’s term. Now in this eleventh loan cycle she is borrowing 19,500 PHP so that she can both repair their existing fishing boat and buy a new one.

Juvy is shown in the photograph above with her boat.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To repair their old boat and buy a new one.

loans.name: Fuamata

texts.en: Fuamata A. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Sataoa Uta A. She is married and has six infant children. Fuamata owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. In 2006, Fuamata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Fuamata is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio is engaged in a retail business, selling different flavors of ice cream on sticks in his village using his motorcycle. He hopes that he could further expand his business by having more items to sell. He dreams of selling his products in different villages, if only he could gain additional capital for his business. He hopes that his first loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos will be granted for the growth of his ice-cream business.

Jovencio is a 50-year-old businessman. He and his wife live together in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela. They are blessed with three children. As a father, he is glad that his children have their own work now. His eldest graduated with a degree in education and she is presently working in Hong Kong. Two of his children are in Manila and busy with their own work. Although they are apart from each other, Jovencio hopes that their good relationship with each other will remain.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Selling pillowcases and kitchen utensils is the business of Milagros B.. Most of her customers are her neighbors and friends. Aside from that, Milagros also raises hogs in her backyard. Her husband is a local carpenter in their village. 

She is thankful because her businesses are able to support their every-day living, but she really wants to see some business progress. Thus she decided to request a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders, which she will use to buy more pillowcases and kitchen utensils to sell. She also plans to use some of the loan to purchase feed for her hogs.

Milagros and her husband are blessed with four children: Edmil (17 years old, high school level), Nico-Boy (16 years old, senior high school student), Angelo (7 years old, a grade 2 pupil) and Angelica (9 years old, a grade 1 pupil ). Her family is living in the village of Anquiray Amulung, Cagayan.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the village of Liposong, Ozamiz city. She is 41 years old. Norma is married and has five school-aged children. Norma operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 48 years old and resides together with her family in the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan.  She is married to a Barangay Councilor and is blessed with five children. The couple helps each other send their three children to school. Their two elder children already finished their schooling and now have their own source of income. According to Aurea, she wants to give a good future to all her children since she doesn’t want them to be like her and not pursue their schooling.
Aurea ventured into the hog raising business five years ago. She sells grown-up hogs and earns income from it. She hopes that her business will further expand by raising more hogs. She seeks assistance from KIVA lenders who could help her improve and maintain her piggery. Aurea is asking to borrow a loan of PHP20,000 as her additional capital to buy feed and additional hogs to raise. It will surely help her in making her business progress.

loans.use: To buy feed and hogs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a resident of Sto. Domingo Luna, Isabela and she has been engaged in the hog raising business for five years.  She is 53 years old and is married to Rogelio, a farmer.  They are blessed with four children, three of whom are already married. 

Editha is thankful that her business is doing well.  However, she still needs additional capital amounting to PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders.  She plans to use the loan to further improve her business and purchase enough feed supply for their growth.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase feed

loans.name: Tauala

texts.en:
Tauala S. is a 55 -year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Sataoa C.  She has 11 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Tauala owns & operates a business venture.  The business operates in the agriculture sector.  The main purpose of the business is raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for S..  Tauala has been engaged in this business for over 6 years.  From these activities, Tauala earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2006, Tauala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.   Taula had a previous loan loan from SPBD which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST.  The current loan will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Tauala plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria and her husband are engaged in manufacturing an improvised stove. It is being assembled by her husband. Gloria helps him in delivering their product to different villages and to some dealers. For each stove, they earn PHP700. Gloria would like to further expand her business to make her business more profitable. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP5,000 to use as additional capital in purchasing more materials needed to manufacture more stoves. According to her, the more capital they have, the more stoves they can make. She hopes that her loan will be granted by some generous KIVA lenders. 

Gloria is 41 years old and she is married to Gabriel who manages his own welding shop in their house. They are blessed with four children; two are married and two are still being supported by them.  They live in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed in their manufacturing business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida B. is 47 years old and already a widow. “Prayer accompanied by hard work” is Adelaida's guiding principle. The couple together with their children are happily living in the village of Anquiray Amulung,Cagayan. Their children are: George, 28 years old and a college undergraduate; Jennifer, 25 years old, and a college undergraduate; Jennifer, 23 years, a college graduate who is working in Manila; and Janice 12 years old, and a  freshman high school student.  Adelaida says that through her business she tries to support her family. But due to the high cost of commodities, the income that she generates from her general store is insufficient for their daily needs. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000, allowing her to make the general store progress. This amount will be a big help in expanding her business and fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Chhoung

texts.en:
Mr. Chhoung V., 63, and his wife, Mrs. Yut Roem, 60, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children, six of whom are sons. Two are construction workers, three work in a factory, and their daughter weaves silk at home. Although the couple is elderly, they are still strong enough to work.

Chhoung has been a construction worker in his village for thirty years. Yut has been a silk weaver for fifteen years. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then markets them in Phnom Penh.

Chhoung is requesting a loan of 200 USD, his first, to purchase silk for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en: Palolo S. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Sataoa Uta A. She is married and has six infant children. Palolo owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. In 2009, Palolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is only 21 years old. She lives together with her family in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela. Imelda is married to Leo who is designated as a Counselor in their village. They are blessed with a daughter who is now four years old. The couple dreams of a good future for their child. They hope to send her to college and have her finish her courses someday. 

Imelda wants to help her husband provide for the needs of their child. She started raising hogs two years ago and she hopes that her livestock business will be maintained and grow further. She hopes for a loan of PHP4,000 as her additional capital to purchase additional hogs to raise. The loan could also help her purchase a supply of feed for her pigs. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: To buy additional hogs and feed for her piggery

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 44 years old and married to Eduardo, who works as a driver in their village. They were gifted with five children: Crisanta, 28 years old, a college graduate; Jonalyn, 24 years old, a college graduate and now working in a factory; Benedict 21 years old, college level, a farmer; Florie Mae, 20 years old, married and a college undergraduate; and Edwin, 18 years old, college level, a carpenter. Aurora is hoping that she can sustain the needs of her family with the income earned through her business. 

Aurora owns and manages a sari-sari store (community-based store) business in their village in Anquiray Amulung, Cagayan. She would like to expand and purchase additional merchandise for her store so she can have an increase in income and at the same time provide the needs of her customers. She is asking to borrow a loan of PHP12,000 as business capital to pursue her business plans. Expanding her business is one of her dreams, so that she can improve their way of living.

loans.use: To buy different commodities for her store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia P. is involved in a direct selling business where she sells products like pillowcases and kitchen utensils. Most of her customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends. Delia P. hopes to have more kitchen utensils to sell to her loyal customers. According to her, she needs additional revolving capital for her retailing business. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more items. Her loan will be of great help in making her business more profitable and that’s why she really hopes for its approval.

Delia is 45 years old and she is married to Felix who has been working as a local carpenter for almost ten years. They’ve been away from each other for the welfare of their children. Engaging in a retail business is her own way to help her husband providen for the needs of their children.

Delia believes that through their hard work and sacrifices, they can achieve their goals in life.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Thoeun E., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Dy Keo, 46, have been married since 1987 and have two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are in school, and two work in a garment factory. They live in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thoeun has been working in district offices since 2002, while his wife has been working in a garment factory. Thoeun is requesting a loan, his first, of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for his children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to get to school.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia P. has been engaged in retailing of goods for 15 years now. She is thankful because her business is still progressing. Ofelia P.’s business serves as her way to help support the needs of her five children. Four of the children are school age and the fifth one is an infant. Because of her desire for her children to finish their schooling, she wants to improve her business and her source of income. Her husband is a farmer and the farm does not support their emergency needs. They can only harvest every four months on their farm.

Ofelia is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 from KIVA lenders for additional capital for her business. She plans to add more variety of goods in her sari-sari store.  She needs additional capital so that she can purchase more merchandise at a time to lessen her transportation expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia L. is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Faleaseela Tai. She is married and has five school-aged children. Telesia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 750 WST a month. Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Telesia is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary U., 41, has been married to Mr. Phea Pok, 45, since 1984 and they have four children: three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a mason. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

One son is a construction worker and other two are in school. One of her sons just finished his beauty salon skill training and runs a beauty salon at his home.

Sotheary has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh. Sotheary is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for continuing her silk weaving and to buy materials for her son’s beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and materials for her son’s beauty salon

loans.name: Norcy

texts.en: Norcy P. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Pesega. She is married and has three infant children. Norcy owns and operates a tailoring business, providing children's tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 420 WST a month. In 2009, Norcy joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is 39 years old and she is married to Dante M.. Her husband is a farmer and he still has enough time to operate his tricycle for passenger services. Susan manages her general store. She has been in this business for almost seven years and it is still growing. They are blessed with three children, and all are taking their studies. Her child named Liezel is 18 years old, supposedly she is now in college but she temporarily stopped because of a lack of funds. Her twins are Leslie and Lester. They are 16 years old and both are candidates for graduating students in high school.

Susan dreams of improving her business in order to continue sending her children to school through the college level. Susan tries her best for the future welfare of her children. At present, she wants to borrow PHP 5,000 for additional capital for her business. She wants to achieve her dreams and goals in life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Leu

texts.en: Leu F. is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Salua Manono. She is married and has five adult children. Leu owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 550 WST a month. In 2009, Leu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Sonak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonak S., 29, a silk weaver, has been married to Mr. Phoun Choun since 2001 and they have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are still young. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sonak’s husband is a silk weaver as well. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to resell in Phnom Penh.

Sonak has asked for a loan from Kiva one time already. She now is requesting her second loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her silk-weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael V. lives in the small village of Barangay Anquiray Amulung, Cagayan where farming is the major source of income. He is 22 years old and single, so he lives with his immediate family. He is a college student taking a Computer Science Course at the private school in Tuguegarao. 

Ismael wants to help his parents provide his daily allowance, so he has started a business selling kitchen utensils to his neighbors and friends.
His loan request of PHP14,000 will be used to purchase additional merchandise to sell to expand his business. Through this, he expects that his sales and his income will increase. He hopes that his business will grow so he can continue to help his parents financially by providing his own daily school allowance. He dreams of finishing his studies and becoming successful in his career in order to help his parents improve their house and their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Luaiva

texts.en:
Luaiva U. is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Pesega. She is married and has five adult children.

Luaiva owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2009, Luaiva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for a loan from SPBD. Luaiva is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread

loans.name: Tali

texts.en: Tali M. is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Lotopa. She is married and has five school-aged children. Tali owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 600 WST a month. In 2007, Tali joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Tali is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun S., 30, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$5 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Soeun S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase fertilizer and land to expand her cultivation. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and land.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long B., 39, is married and lives with her two young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for US$2 each day, while her husband is a moto-taxi driver making US$2.50 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Long B. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a water pump and pipe.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and pipe.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S., 26, is married and lives with her two young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for US$5 each day, while her husband, pictured here, is a worker making US$2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sun S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase farmland. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to purchase more land to produce fruit with the loan given to her through CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun M., 44, pictured with his wife, Mrs. Houn Duch, 45, has been married since 1986. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married, one of whom lives in the family home. One son is a driver and other son studies in a local school. They live in a small village off of National Road Number 2 about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Bunthoeun and his wife have been farming since they were married. They grow rice and vegetables. Bunthoeun is now asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase a horse cart to carry his produce. This will make it easier for him to transport his produce from the field to the house.

loans.use: To purchase a horse cart to carry his products

loans.name: Mr. Sokheng Hang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of fifteen people, is located in Tonle Bati village in Takeo province and each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Sokheng H. is the village bank president. He is a farmer who owns 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which he cultivates rice.

His wife, Mrs. Nhoek Sokhun, is a grocer. In this business, she can earn a little income to support the family. Now she wants to add to her business by purchasing fertilizers to resell to earn more income. Thus, Mr. Sokheng H. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mr. Sokheng H. is 55 years old and the father of three children, all of whom stay at home to do housework and help with their mother’s business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his wife to resell

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan L., 19, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. Since 2007, she has been selling grocery items to earn a living and is able to make about US$4 of profit every day. Her husband is a farmer making approximately US$3 each day. Chan L. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a more groceries to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store

loans.name: Bayar

texts.en:
Bayar H. is 40 years old and has three daughters and two sons, ranging from 10 to 16 years old. He currently resides with his wife and five children in Bayan-Olgii province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. All five children go to local secondary schools. Bayar and his wife have a small meat retail business. Bayar visits herder families in Bulgan soum, a small town 300 km away, and purchases sheep and cattle. He sells them at a local food market for profit and the sheep and cattle that he is able to sell at the market are slaughtered and sold in small pieces at his wife's stall. The collaboration of Bayar and his wife lowers the risk of the sheep and cattle not being sold. The couple has been in the meat retail business together since 2004 and been doing very well. Bayar says that as the business expands, he and his wife would like to open saving accounts for his five children, in order to secure their future well-being. Bayar requests a loan to purchase more sheep and cattle for his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and cattle

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen Y., 40, is married and lives with her four children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for US$3 each day, while her husband is a worker making US$2 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Pen Y. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase farmland, a water pump and pipe. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to purchase more land to produce fruit with the loan given to her through CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase farmland, a water pump and pipe.

loans.name: Vaga

texts.en: Vaga T. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Pesega. She is married and does not have any children. Vaga owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. In 2009, Vaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Tak Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mao T. is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. N. Phal, is a traditional musician. H. also works in construction. Mrs. Mao T. is applying for a loan to buy duck eggs, beefsteak and other snacks to sell to earn more income for her family. SH. is 42 years old and tH. mother of five children: three are employed in a factory and tH. others are attending tH. local school. SH. is tH. village bank president who has been selected by tH. members. This village bank consists of twelve people who all live in Tonle Bati village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy duck eggs, beefsteak and other snacks to resell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 29, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who makes US$7 every day, while her husband sells fruit at the local market to earn approximately US$5 per day. Chea S. is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase fertilizer and seed to expand her cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed to expand her cultivation.

loans.name: Thok

texts.en: Thok C., 41, is married and lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for US$1.60 each day, while her husband is a horse-cart driver making US$7 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Thok C. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a new horse cart for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a new horse cart for her husband.

loans.name: Mrs. Ra Kum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who are all living in Tonle Bati village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Ra K. is the village bank president who has been selected the members. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Ra K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from farming this plantation, she sells fish caught by her husband, Mr. Pun Chroeng, who is a fisherman.

With his fishing, Mr. Pun Chroeng faces an obstacle because he does not have enough fishing nets and this affects his income. Thus, Mrs. Ra K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets for her husband’s fishing.

Mrs. Ra K. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets for her husband

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min A. is 44 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, they typically make  US$3 each day. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work making candles. Min A. is asking for a loan of US$750 that her husband needs to purchase fishing tools. Her husband can take time to fish for an additional income to help raise the standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum H., 43, is married and lives with her six children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works in construction making US$4 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sum H. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Leak Ty Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people and they all live in Tonle Bati village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Srey Leak T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Lay Bun Chhorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is employed operating a rice mill (a machine used to remove the chaff and outer husks from rice grains).

Now Mrs. Srey Leak T. wants to become a dessert seller to earn income for her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some plates, glasses, tables, chairs, and some ingredients to make dessert to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living with this loan.

Mrs. Srey Leak T. is 31 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Visal T. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy equipment and ingredients to make and sell dessert

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen Z. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 31 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Ellen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Sarah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., age 40, is married and lives with her five children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for US $2 each day, while her husband, pictured here, is a horse-cart driver who makes US $3 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have made this a difficult year for many Cambodians, Seng S. included. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of US $300. Her husband will use the money to purchase a new horse-cart.

loans.use: purchasing a new horse-cart

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina I. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Seesee K. She is married and has four school-aged children.

Lesina owns and operates a handicraft business, selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 0, Lesina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

Lesina is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. The loan will be her 6th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Nguon S. is 22 years old and sells fruits in the Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$1.30 every day, while her husband is a horse-cart driver making US$4.10 per day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$500 that her husband needs to purchase a new horse-cart.

loans.use: To purchase a horse-cart.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokunth Suon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokunth S. is a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more supplies for her weaving. Her husband, Mr. Kang L. Heng, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. This couple has five children: one is a teacher at the local school, two are weavers and the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Mrs. Sokunth S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Seventeen people who all live in Chanieng Khpos village in Takeo province make up this village bank. They will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Kruoch P. did not come to take a loan but her husband is, so he is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for weaving

loans.name: Sakin

texts.en: Mrs. Sakin E., a 50-year-old single woman from Svay Preak village in Kandal province, is a farmer. She owns a piece of land and cultivates both rice and vegetables. She faces an obstacle with her plantation because her field has infertile soil and she does not have enough money. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water for the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Rustamhon

texts.ru: Рустамхон Гаюров проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Рустамхон по специальности "фотограф". Он более 20 лет работает в фотосалоне "фотографом". Кредит просит для покупки нового фотоаппарата, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Rustamhon G. lives in the city of Kulob. He's forty-four years old, married and has four children. Rustamhon has worked as a photographer for more than twenty years in a photo studio. He is asking for a loan in order to buy a new camera with which he could provide better quality services.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new camera

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi T. is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Vaimoso Jr. She is married and has twelve adult children. Emi owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 550 WST a month. In 2008, Emi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Emi is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. Emi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Judith Akinyi

texts.en: Judith A sells dresses, tops, inner-wear, t-shirts and trousers to an established clientele. She also caters for walk-in clients at the busy Manyatta-Koyango market (local market). Her business challenges are fluctuating preferences, customer tastes and needs (eg. customers preferring second-hand clothes) and strong competition. She is using the proceeds of KES20,000 to purchase one bale of dresses and dress tops. In the future, she wants to own a boutique, build a decent house for her family and take her children to a better school. Judith is twenty-three years old, married and has three children. She describes herself as determined and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy one bale of dresses and ladies tops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband to make more plows to sell

loans.name: Abdugani

texts.ru: Курбонов Абдугани проживает в районе Шазритуз. Возраст 45 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка, дети помогают отцу. Абдугани более 6 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Кредит просит для покупки скота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Abdugani K., 45, lives in the Shahrituz region. Abdugani, assisted by his wife and children, has bred livestock for over six years: fattening and then selling large cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy more livestock. He would like to repair his house with the profit.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Christine Achieng

texts.en: Christine is twenty four years old and married with four children. For the last four years, she has been selling new and used clothing. Her business is threatened by strong competition from similar businesses and hurt by the relative lack of customers during the rainy season. She will be using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy used and new clothes in order to prepare herself for the festive season, when demand is expected to more than double. In the future, she wants to own a large boutique in Kisumu City. Christine describes herself as hardworking, patient and determined.

loans.use: purchasing new and used clothes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen C. is from the village of Galas. She is 41 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling different kind of snacks in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and additionally to purchase materials for their footwear-making activity. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and also materials to make footwear

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида Хучамуродова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 21 год. Замужем, детей не имеет. Фарида более 3 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает запчасти от велосипеда. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента, т.е. хоз. товаров для расширения бизнеса. Ей в этом также помогает муж.
texts.en:
Farida H. lives in the Shahrituz region. She's twenty-one years old, married and has no children. For more than three years Farida, assisted by her husband, has sold spare bicycle parts on the market. She is requesting a loan in order to buy new household supplies and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new supplies

loans.name: Lilian Awour

texts.en:
Lilian makes and sells dresses. She also stocks and sells materials for making clothes. She started her buiness a year ago and the business is doing well.  She has one employee; her main problem is the rainy season, during which sales are unpredictable.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine and more materials for making clothes. She wants to capitalise on the festive season, during which demand for dresses is at its peak. She intends to open a new shop and would like to have a brighter future for her family. Lilian is married with one son and describes herself as a hardworking, optimistic, responsible and caring mother.

loans.use: purchasing a sewing machine and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида Ниезматова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 28 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж занимается производством детских столиков. Сама Фарида более 8 лет занимается торговлей на рынке, она в основном торгует хоз. товарами. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Farida N., 28, lives in the Shahrituz region. She's married and has three children. Her husband builds tables for young children. For the past eight years Farida has worked on the market, selling household goods. She is asking for a loan in order to buy new supplies.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new supplies

loans.name: Joelor

texts.en:
Joelor V. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 41 years old. Joelor is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Joelor owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Joelor has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Joelor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joelor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Joelor is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Joelor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Badal

texts.ru: Бадал Мунаварова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Мунавара по специальности "учительница", но она более 9 лет занимается торговлей, она торгует запчастями от велосипеда. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Badal M. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 47 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Badal is a teacher by profession, but she has been in the retail business for more than nine years now. She sells spare parts for bicycles. She is asking for a loan to buy a new assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new assortment

loans.name: Bahitbek

texts.en:
Bahitbek S. is a 23-year-old father of a 1-year-old daughter. He lives with his wife and daughter in Bayan-Olgii province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Bahitbek drove his small van in the town for passenger service until 2008, and then decided to hire his brother as a driver for his van, in order to pursue another business in the meantime. His wife works as a conductor in the passenger van, and Bahitbek now runs another small business in order to expand his business horizon.  Fall is usually the season for families to stockpile their winter food, especially meat which is the most important and significant ingredient for a Mongolian family's diet in the winter. As the demand for mutton and beef significantly increases seasonally, he purchases livestock from herders in the countryside and sells the meat in smaller quantities in town to buyers. He says that he is working hard to make his business sustainable and profitable, in order to best support his family.
He requests a loan to purchase mutton and beef from herders. In the picture, Bahitbek standing on the right-hand side.





About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to decrease poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: to purchase mutton and beef from herders.

loans.name: Mary Apondi

texts.en: Apondi is twenty four years old, married, and has been blessed with a two year old son.  She owns "Mama Tony Fashions" where she makes and sells dresses to local customers at Manyatta market.  Her business challenges are strong: there is competition from similar businesses, and significant price inflation of materials for making dresses.  She will use the proceeds of KES 15,000 to purchase rolls of fabric and tailoring materials.  In the future, she wants to open a big tailoring shop.  Apondi describes herself as creative and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rolls of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Adebiyet

texts.en:
Adibiyet S. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and four young children in Bayan-Olgii province, one of the western provinces in Mongolia. His four children's ages range from 6 to 12 years, and all study in local secondary school. Adibiyet runs a small business in meat selling. He has been selling meat, especially mutton and beef to local buyers since 1998. With his wife, he purchases livestock from herders in the countryside and sells them in carcasses especially after winter. In the spring, meat prices increase as the supply for meat declines. Thus, Adibiyet would like to purchase mutton and beef now when prices are seasonally low, and store it well until springtime comes. When spring arrives, he will be selling the well-kept beef and mutton at the higher price in order to make a significant profit. He says that he is well experienced in the meat selling business and would like to do well in order to secure his four children's futures and well-being. 
He requests a loan to purchase beef and mutton for his small business.

loans.use: to purchase beef and mutton

loans.name: Alice Indangasi

texts.en:
Alice owns the Mama Melvo Fashion Shop and sells shoes, bags, t-shirts, dresses and trousers to repeat and walk-in customers. She has been operating this business for the last two years. Her business is located by the roadside and alongside a busy local market. Her business challenges are strong competition from similar businesses and disturbances from local authorities (municipal police).

She is using the loan of 20,000 KES to buy bags, ladies' trousers and t- shirts. In the future, she wants to expand her business into a big boutique shop and to build a decent house for her family. Alice is married with two children and describes herself as a hardworking and aggressive person.

loans.use: To buy twenty bags, two hundred ladies trousers and one hundred T-shirts.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Юлдашева проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 25 лет. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Фируза более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Она выращивает пшеницу, картошку, и лук. Кредит просит для закупа удобрений, и семян, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Firuza Y. lives in the Shakhrituz region. She is 25 years old. She is married, with one child. Her husband is working in Russia. Firuza herself has been farming for 10 years. She grows wheat, potatoes, and onions. She is asking for the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant a new crop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting a new crop

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en:
Zorigtbaatar E. is a father of three children and currently lives with his family in Dornogobi province, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. All his children are high school students and his wife has a small business.

Zorigtbaatar owns a small truck that he uses for his transportation business. Since 2004, he has been doing some transportation for local businesses. He usually carries luggage and bags of coal for locals. This year, he is expanding the horizon of his business and has started selling what he used to transport, such as coal. He now purchases a few tons of coal from wholesalers and sells it by the bag to locals who use coal for their stoves to heat their homes.

He requests a loan to purchase more coal for his small business.

loans.use: to purchase more coal to sell

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda D. D. M. resiD. en Ciudad Arce del municipio D. La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos D. 24,17, 13 y 11 años D. edad, todos estudiantes. A sus 43 años D. edad Herlinda maneja con éxito su negocio, un panadería donD. elabora diferente tipos D. panquecitos para ser comercializados D. manera ambulante en su colonia, la demanda D. Herlinda a ido en aumento razón por la cual ella está dispuesta a solicitar un crédito con el cual comprara harina, levadura, manteca ; elementos utilizados en la producción D. su pan.
texts.en:
Herlinda D. D. M. is a resident of the town of Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her four children (ages 24, 17, 13, and 11). All of them are students. Herlinda is 43 years old and has successfully managed her business. She operates a bakery where she produces different types of muffins, which she sells in her neighborhood as a street vendor. The demand for her product is growing, so she is requesting a loan so that she can to buy flour, yeast, butter, and other items used in making baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Zanabayar

texts.en:
Zanabazar N. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and six-year-old son in Bayan-Ulgii province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. She runs a small carpentry shop with her husband.

Her husband is a talented carpenter who is good at making wooden furniture and other wooden objects. He is now making traditional wooden furniture to order but is currently lacking in working capital for making large furniture.

He mostly spends his business profits, after family basic expenses, for buying wood and other necessary materials for his business. Zanabazar says that she would like to expand her family carpentry business and be able to make large furniture for locals. She further adds that her family is working hard to expand the business and be more successful.

She requests a loan for working capital to purchase necessary materials for the business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for the business

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es: Roxana Del Carmen M. E. de 49 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Roxana vive con sus tres hijos Griselda de 14 años, Manuel de 12 años e Ingrid de 4 años de edad, el esposo no se encuentra viviendo en el país ya que hace unos años emigro a Estados Unidos para poder conseguir un empleo y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia, ahora Roxana se dedica de lleno a su negocio que se encuentra ubicada en su casa, es una pequeña tienda con insumos para el hogar, que ahora a través de este crédito tiene el deseo de poder surtirla con más variedad de mercadería y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Roxana Del Carmen M. E. is 49 years old and resides in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her three children: Griselda (age 14), Manuel (age 12), and Ingrid (age 4). Her husband does not live in the country because he went to the United States a few years ago to find employment and improve the family’s financial condition. Roxana now devotes herself to her small home business selling household supplies. She is requesting this loan so that she can restock her store with a greater variety of merchandise and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sara Noemy

texts.es: Sara Noemy P. G. reside en el municipio de Colon del departamento de La Libertad. Sara tiene 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, Angelina de 8 años y Stefany de 6 años de edad. Hace dos años Sara inicio su negocio con la idea de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y es así como inicio la venta de productos de consumo para el hogar, comercializándolos desde su domicilio, a pesar que sus ventas son estables, Sara no ha logrado surtir su negocio ya que necesita un capital en efectivo que es estos momentos no posee, es por ello que solicita de tu ayuda  a través del crédito, con el que Sara podrá surtir su negocio y así seguir creciendo en sus ventas.
texts.en:
